0.title: Pune family arranges ₹1 lakh chopper ride for newborn daughter, video surfaces
0.article_body: A family arranged a chopper ride worth ₹1 lakh to bring home their newborn girl child in Pune's Shelgaon. A video shows the family members welcoming the child in traditional attire as the chopper landed. The girl's father, Vishal Zarekar said, "We did not have a girl child in our entire family."

1.title: Mumbai hospital suspends ward boy for breaching patient's privacy
1.article_body: Dr LH Hiranandani Hospital in Mumbai's Powai has suspended a ward boy for a week for allegedly breaching a 35-year-old writer's privacy when she was undergoing ECG. The victim claimed the ward boy entered the cubicle when the procedure was underway last week. A three-member committee concluded he had no mala fide intent and will undergo extensive patient care training.

2.title: Heatwave in Delhi may get severe, to continue for next 6 days: IMD
2.article_body: The ongoing heatwave in Delhi is predicted to become more severe as no relief is in sight for at least six days, the India Meteorological Department (IMD) said on Tuesday. Delhi's maximum temperature is expected to touch the 40°C mark on Wednesday and rise to 42°C by Friday. Prolonged dry spell responsible for Delhi's "severe" heatwave, IMD officials said.

3.title: We missed T Natarajan in T20 World Cup 2021: Ravi Shastri
3.article_body: Former Team India head coach Ravi Shastri has said that the team missed T Natarajan in the T20 World Cup 2021. "He would've been a certainty had he been fit. He got injured against England when we were playing the ODI series and we really missed him," Shastri said. He added, "Natarajan...bowls...yorkers very skilfully. He has got great control."

4.title: RCB score 104 runs in last 55 balls, hand RR their first defeat in IPL 2022
4.article_body: RCB handed RR their first defeat in IPL 2022 after beating them by four wickets on Tuesday. RR put up a total of 169/3, with Jos Buttler scoring 70*(47). RCB, who were 69/4 after 10 overs, went on to chase down the target in 19.1 overs, scoring 173/6. RCB's Shahbaz Ahmed scored 45(26), while Dinesh Karthik scored 44*(23).

5.title: Czech Republic sends tanks to Ukraine in latest military aid
5.article_body: The Czech Republic has sent tanks and infantry fighting vehicles to Ukraine, Reuters reported citing a Czech source. Several NATO countries have responded to Ukraine's request for military aid to fight Russian forces invading the country. NATO allies will discuss the delivery of more weapons to Ukraine when Foreign Ministers meet on Wednesday and Thursday, Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said.

6.title: US, UK & Australia plan to develop hypersonic missiles under AUKUS
6.article_body: A US official said that the US, the UK and Australia plan to work together via their security alliance known as AUKUS to develop hypersonic missiles. The move comes amid growing concern by the US and allies about China's growing military assertiveness in the Pacific, a report said. In October, the US said China had tested a hypersonic weapon system.

7.title: Kohli should bat with open stance initially to counter inswingers: Akram
7.article_body: After observing Virat Kohli's form in IPL 2022 so far, Wasim Akram said RCB batter should play with an open stance in first couple of overs to negotiate the inswinging deliveries. He added that Kohli should play with a straight bat if he's struggling against left-armers. Akram further said that Kohli would be unstoppable if he survives first two overs.

8.title: Asiatic lions facing challenges, need human-free area: Cong MP
8.article_body: Raising the issue of need for human-free areas for Asiatic lions, Congress MP Rajani Patil told Rajya Sabha on Tuesday that lions are "facing...lot of challenges because...protected forest areas are shared by human population", adding, Gujarat's Gir forest has only 250 sq km of human-free area. She also claimed the Gujarat government is "reluctant" to implement scientific counting of lions.

9.title: Apple to host Worldwide Developers Conference virtually from June 6-10
9.article_body: Apple announced that it will host its annual Worldwide Developers Conference (WWDC) in an online format from June 6-10. It will be the third year in a row that the event will be hosted virtually. WWDC is a software-focused event where Apple unveils new iPhone, iPad, Apple Watch software. Apple is expected to unveil iOS 16 for iPhone this year.

10.title: Finland and Sweden welcome to join NATO: Secretary General
10.article_body: Finland and Sweden would be welcomed in NATO by member countries if the two Nordic nations decided to join the alliance, Secretary General Jens Stoltenberg said. Last Month, a Russian official had said that military and political consequences may follow if the two countries join NATO. Tensions between Russia and the West are high over the Russian invasion of Ukraine.

11.title: WB's state would've been worse had it been a country: WB BJP chief
11.article_body: West Bengal BJP president Dr Sukanta Kumar Majumdar on Tuesday said that the state's condition would've been worse than Sri Lanka had it been a separate country. "Chief Minister Mamata Banerjee should take care of her state. Sri Lanka is ruined; its total debt was ₹6 lakh crore and West Bengal's debt is ₹5.62 lakh crore," he further said.

12.title: Seems CPI(M) forced Naseeruddin to record video appeal for niece: Babul
12.article_body: After actor Naseeruddin Shah shared a video appealing to people to vote for his niece and CPI(M) candidate Saira Shah Halim in bypoll to Bengal's Ballygunge seat, TMC leader Babul Supriyo said it seemed that he was forced to record the video. "We all love and respect Naseeruddin Shah...but sadly he looks very gloomy in this video," Supriyo tweeted.

13.title: Girl named 'Madhu's 5th child' enrolled to UP school as CMO intervenes
13.article_body: A girl, whose Aadhaar card named her as 'Baby Five of Madhu', was admitted to a government school in UP's Budaun after CMO intervened. "The teacher made fun of name mentioned on my daughter's Aadhaar card...and didn't admit her there," her mother claimed. An official said she was enrolled on April 2 and a correction was suggested for her Aadhaar.

14.title: Centre's reply sought on alleged gender bias in Hindu Succession Act
14.article_body: SC on Tuesday gave Centre four weeks' time to reply to a plea, alleging that Sections 15 and 16 of the Hindu Succession Act, 1956, violate gender equality. The plea said a dead Hindu woman's husband's family gets priority in inheritance before her own parents. However, when a man dies, his property is distributed among his heirs, including his parents.

15.title: Looking forward to learning the most from Younis Khan: Rashid
15.article_body: Afghanistan spinner Rashid Khan, who is currently playing in IPL 2022, said he's looking forward to learning the most from newly-appointed Afghanistan batting coach Younis Khan. Along with Younis, Umar Gul was appointed as bowling coach ahead of upcoming preparatory camp in UAE. Afghanistan's 25-member squad is set to leave for Abu Dhabi to get through their UAE citizenship process.

16.title: 'This is what 80-20 meant': AAP leader on BJP amid rise in fuel prices
16.article_body: Aam Aadmi Party leader Sanjay Singh on Tuesday said that BJP's '80-20' remark meant that it would increase petrol and diesel prices by 80 paise each for 20 consecutive days. "During the entire election in Uttar Pradesh, the BJP kept saying that we are contesting on 80-20," he said. UP CM Yogi Adityanath made the remark in January.

17.title: 4 members of a gang who posed as policemen to loot people held in UP
17.article_body: Four members of an inter-state looter's gang, the Irani Gang, who posed as policemen to loot people, were arrested in Uttar Pradesh's Varanasi on Tuesday, police said. A Satish Ganesh, Commissioner of Police (Varanasi), said that gold jewellery, ₹58,000 in cash, two country-made pistols, a four-wheeler were recovered from their possession. Around 6kg of marijuana was also recovered, he added.

18.title: OnePlus 10 Pro, Bullets Wireless Z2 & Buds Pro Radiant Silver go on sale
18.article_body: OnePlus begins open sale for OnePlus 10 Pro, Bullets Wireless Z2 and Buds Pro Radiant Silver starting 5 April across OnePlus.in, OnePlus Store app, OnePlus exclusive offline stores, Amazon.in, and all partner outlets. OnePlus 10 Pro will be available in two colors, Volcanic Black and Emerald Forest, starting at ₹66,999 for 8GB/128GB variant and ₹71,999 for 12GB/256GB variant.

19.title: Deeply concerned over economic crisis in Sri Lanka: US
19.article_body: The US on Tuesday said that it's deeply concerned over Sri Lanka's economic crisis and urged authorities to exercise constraint. "We urge authorities to...avoid social media blackouts and arrests under the Prevention of Terrorism Act," US State Department official Ned Price tweeted. Sri Lanka is grappling with a shortage of essential items, including medicines, and rolling power cuts.

20.title: Party that censored Kishore's songs is crying for democracy: Shah on Cong
20.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah, while speaking in the Rajya Sabha on Tuesday, criticised the Congress saying, "The party which imposed the Emergency...censored Kishore Kumar's songs is crying for democracy today?" Shah was speaking on the Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022. "Those who forget history, become history. I can see it in the House before me," Shah added.

21.title: Middleman arrested after complaint on Punjab's graft helpline
21.article_body: A middleman, allegedly engaged by a patwari, was arrested by the vigilance bureau in Punjab's Ferozepur for taking a ₹1,000 bribe. The patwari had demanded a bribe to do the mutation of a piece of land bought by the complainant, police said. The complainant, however, recorded a video while paying the bribe and sent it to the newly-launched anti-corruption helpline.

22.title: Protestors 'exceeded fundamental right to peacefully protest': Court
22.article_body: A Delhi Court on Tuesday denied bail to the protestors, who targeted Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal's house and said that the accused exceeded the "fundamental right to peacefully protest". The court said that while the right to assemble and protest is a fundamental one, "such a right is subject to certain restrictions and is not an uncontrolled one".

23.title: Latvia & Estonia to close 4 Russian consulates amid Ukraine war
23.article_body: Latvia and Estonia have ordered the closure of four Russian consulates and expulsion of their respective staff amid the Russian invasion of Ukraine, the countries' foreign ministries said on Tuesday. Consulates in Latvia's Daugavpils and Liepaja and Estonia's Tartu and Narva will close by end of April. Lithuania expelled Russian Ambassador and downgraded diplomatic ties with the country on Monday.

24.title: Haryana a tenant in Chandigarh, should get own capital: Ex-min Dalal
24.article_body: Terming the ongoing dispute between Haryana and Punjab governments over capital Chandigarh as 'ghisa pita' (stale), former Haryana minister Karan Dalal on Monday said the issue is being used to mislead public. He added, Haryana should think of creating a new capital. "For...last 55 years, Haryana...occupied Chandigarh as a tenant...now it's time to think about...independent capital," Dalal said.

25.title: Individuals can use UPI for public issue payments of up to ₹5 lakh
25.article_body: SEBI on Tuesday said individual investors applying in public issues of equity shares can use UPI for application amount of up to ₹5 lakh from May 1 onwards. Investors have also been asked to provide their UPI ID in the bid-cum-application form. National Payments Corporation of India had increased per transaction limit in UPI to ₹5 lakh in December 2021.

26.title: Milk prices to stay firm, can only go up from here: Amul MD
26.article_body: Milk prices will remain firm and can only increase from their current rates, Amul MD RS Sodhi said. Inflation in the milk industry isn't a concern as farmers' profits have increased due to hike in prices, he added. Amul is not affected by increased pressure from energy, logistics and packaging costs as profit-making is not Amul's core objective, Sodhi said.

27.title: 'KGF 2' was the first offer I got from the South: Sanjay Dutt
27.article_body: Actor Sanjay Dutt said 'KGF: Chapter 2' is the first-ever South Indian film that was offered to him. "I don't know why (I was never approached before)," he stated. Sanjay added he "instantly" said yes to the film when the role of Adheera was offered to him. "This character is as strong as Kancha Cheena was in 'Agneepath'," he said.

28.title: Fuel shortage at Russia's embassy in Ireland in backlash over invasion
28.article_body: The Russian embassy in Ireland has complained of a shortage of fuel after its provider refused to deliver diesel. Calling for the Irish government to intervene "into this clearly discriminatory case", the embassy said that other providers had "refused to cooperate". Reportedly, this is a backlash against the invasion of Ukraine by Russia.

29.title: I feel betrayed: Chirag Paswan on eviction from Delhi bungalow
29.article_body: Lok Janshakti Party leader Chirag Paswan has said he felt "betrayed" and "humiliated" by the way the government bungalow in Delhi allotted to his father late Ram Vilas Paswan was vacated. He said, "I don't feel bad about losing...house" adding that he objects to the way in which it was done. "[We'd] never think of claiming [the house]," he added.

30.title: Pregnant Anganwadi worker dies of electrocution in MP's Bhopal
30.article_body: A 29-year-old Anganwadi worker, who was four months pregnant, died after being electrocuted in Madhya Pradesh's Bhopal on Monday. According to her family members, she received an electric shock after accidentally touching a nearby cooler while washing clothes, following which she was rushed to hospital. She was, however, declared dead after being shifted to another hospital for better treatment.

31.title: It is a time to give chance to AAP in Himachal Pradesh: Jain
31.article_body: AAP leader Satyendar Jain on Tuesday said that people are tired of BJP and Congress, adding that "now it's time to give a chance to the AAP" in Himachal Pradesh. Jain said, "AAP is dedicated to public welfare, while other political leaders are busy ensuring their personal welfare." AAP will contest all 68 seats in the Himachal Pradesh Assembly elections.

32.title: 3 tigers found dead in last 3 days in Madhya Pradesh jungles
32.article_body: At least three tigers have been found dead in two forests of Madhya Pradesh in last three days, forest officials said on Monday. Officials found a carcass of five-month-old cub at Satpura Tiger Reserve on Saturday, while they found another injured tiger nearby, who later succumbed to injuries. In Balaghat forest area, tiger died due to territorial fight on Sunday.

33.title: Actress Tejasswi Prakash buys Audi Q7 worth ₹1 crore, pics surface
33.article_body: Actress Tejasswi Prakash bought an Audi Q7, which is worth ₹1 crore, on Tuesday. Pinkvilla's official Instagram handle shared pictures of Tejasswi and her boyfriend Karan Kundrra in the Audi showroom. Reacting to the post, Karan commented, "It's Tejasswi's car...I was only the ghar ka (personal) videographer." Several fans congratulated Tejasswi for buying the car.

34.title: Kamal & I were almost arrested in US during Vishwaroopam shoot: Jaideep
34.article_body: Jaideep Ahlawat recalled an incident from the shooting of 'Vishwaroopam' on a bridge in the US where he and Kamal Haasan were almost arrested. Jaideep said there were "8-10" police cars for them when he and Kamal reached the toll in their third round trip. "Cops started yelling...I was thinking...'Please don't shoot'," he stated. "They realised it's...film shoot," Jaideep added.

35.title: Who are India's 10 richest people according to Forbes' latest rich list?
35.article_body: Mukesh Ambani is India's richest person with $90.7 billion wealth as of March 11, Forbes' latest rich list released on Tuesday stated. Gautam Adani is second-richest in India with $90 billion wealth, followed by HCL Tech's Shiv Nadar ($28.7 billion) and Cyrus Poonawalla ($24.3 billion). DMart's Radhakishan Damani is fifth-richest in India with $20 billion wealth and Lakshmi Mittal sixth-richest.

36.title: Rashmika Mandanna joins actor Vijay in 'Thalapathy 66'
36.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna has joined actor Vijay for his upcoming film that is tentatively titled 'Thalapathy 66'. The makers of the film made the announcement on Rashmika's 26th birthday. Taking to Twitter, the makers wrote, "Wishing the talented and gorgeous Rashmika a very Happy Birthday! Welcome onboard." The film will be directed by Vamshi Paidipally.

37.title: RR have best bowling attack in IPL 2022: Wasim Jaffer
37.article_body: Ex-India cricketer Wasim Jaffer said RR, who are currently at top of IPL standings, have best bowling attack in the tournament this year. "They have a well-rounded attack and have a lot of wicket-taking options," he added. Jaffer further said that RR are first team in IPL 2022 that have lost the toss in both the matches and won them.

38.title: Civilians crushed with tanks for Russians' pleasure: Zelenskyy tells UN
38.article_body: Likening Russia's actions in Ukraine to that of terrorist organisations such as the Islamic State, Ukraine's President Volodymyr Zelenskyy urged the UNSC to "act immediately" or shut down. Talking about Russian atrocities in Bucha, he said, "Civilians were crushed by tanks while sitting in their cars...just for their pleasure...Women were raped and killed in front of their children."

39.title: Not an inch of India's land ceded since Modi became PM: Rijiju
39.article_body: Not an inch of land has been ceded since Narendra Modi became Prime Minister, Minister of Law and Justice Kiren Rijiju said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Everyone knows that our claimed territory under the control of China and Pakistan dates back to earlier times. I don't want to take anyone's name," Rijiju further said.

40.title: Probe ordered after video shows UP man taking wife to hospital on cart
40.article_body: A probe was ordered by Uttar Pradesh's Deputy Chief Minister Brajesh Pathak on Tuesday, a day after a video showed a man taking his wife to a hospital on a hand cart in Ballia district. The woman died on the same night during treatment, said Ballia Chief Medical Officer (CMO) Neeraj Pandey.

41.title: Builder Sanjay Biyani shot dead outside his house in Maha; incident caught on CCTV
41.article_body: Builder Sanjay Biyani was shot dead by unknown assailants at his residence in Maharashtra's Nanded in broad daylight on Tuesday. A CCTV footage of the incident has also surfaced online, showing the accused men, who came on a two-wheeler, shooting at him. Police said that it looks like a planned attack on the builder.

42.title: Use influence to mediate Russia-Ukraine truce: Tharoor to govt
42.article_body: Congress MP Shashi Tharoor on Tuesday said that the Indian government should use its influence to mediate a truce between Russia and Ukraine amid the conflict. India should not shy away from taking a morally correct position in line with its foreign policy, he added. Separately, Tharoor also expressed concern about the emerging Russia-China-Pakistan axis.

43.title: Nadal not jealous about Alcaraz, he knows Miami winner is great: Corretja
43.article_body: Comparing Spaniards Rafael Nadal and Carlos Alcaraz, who recently won his first ATP 1000 Masters title in Miami, ex-world number two Alex Corretja said he's hopeful that soon 18-year-old will be close to 21-time Grand Slam champion. "Rafael isn't jealous of Alcaraz. He knows...Alcaraz is great," he added. Alcaraz became third youngest 1000 Masters winner after Michael Chang and Nadal.

44.title: McLaren receive FIA Environmental Accreditation for 9th straight year
44.article_body: Formula One team McLaren on Monday said they have received the FIA's three-star Environmental Accreditation for the ninth consecutive year since 2013. "McLaren Racing has a legacy of sustainable leadership, and we recognize our responsibility to provide solutions to sustainability challenges through our people, operations and practices," McLaren's Director of Sustainability Kim Wilson said.

45.title: Worked hard for BJP, had aspiration for promotion: Babul Supriyo
45.article_body: Trinamool Congress (TMC) leader Babul Supriyo revealed on Tuesday that he had previously "retired hurt from politics" as his "aspirations for promotion" in BJP didn't work out. "I felt that PM Modi...didn't have regard for knowledge...I worked hard for BJP since 2014," he added. Supriyo will contest as TMC's candidate for West Bengal Assembly by-polls from the Ballygunge seat.

46.title: 42 militants killed in last 3 months in J&K: DGP Dilbag Singh
46.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir DGP Dilbag Singh on Tuesday said that 42 militants were killed in 2022 so far and further vowed to intensify counter-insurgency measures in the valley. This comes after a CRPF personnel martyred in a militant attack on Monday in Srinagar. "This...won't be tolerated," Singh said as he participated in the wreath-laying ceremony of the CRPF personnel today.

47.title: Not worth his life: Sahil Shah shares post after delivery boy suffers breakdown
47.article_body: Comedian Sahil Shah took to Twitter after he witnessed a delivery agent breakdown as he had suffered three accidents while trying to deliver his food. Shah said he gave him a good tip and apologised to him as his dinner shouldn't be "worth his life". He further advised people to be nice to their delivery agents and respect them.

48.title: At this point of time yes: Karthik on assigned a finisher's role for RCB
48.article_body: On being asked if he's been assigned a finisher's role in IPL 2022, RCB wicketkeeper-batter Dinesh Karthik said, "At this point of time yes, it looks like that for sure." He added, "That's what they've told me- message is very clear." Karthik, batting at number seven, scored a 7-ball 14* to help his side win against KKR by three wickets.

49.title: Maruti Suzuki celebrates 10 lakh S-CNG owners
49.article_body: Maruti Suzuki announced a new sales milestone as cumulative sales of its S-CNG vehicles crosses the 10 lakh unit mark. The company stated that it strives to provide customers with safe, dependable, technologically advanced, and environmental-friendly vehicles. Customers can now choose from the portfolio of 9 cars across multiple engine options in S-CNG.

50.title: World no. 2 Medvedev could be banned from playing Wimbledon this year
50.article_body: World number two Daniil Medvedev could be banned from playing Wimbledon this year as tournament officials are in talks with the UK government over a potential ban of Russian and Belarusian athletes. The All England Club, which hosts the Grand Slam tournament, could be allowed to ban Russian and Belarusian athletes without any legal repercussions due to its independent status.

51.title: Kuwait's govt resigns ahead of no-trust vote amid political crisis
51.article_body: The Kuwaiti government on Tuesday resigned ahead of a no-confidence vote in the Parliament against the Prime Minister. Notably, this is the country's third collective government resignation in the past year and a half. The worsening political crisis has blocked critical economic and social reforms in the Gulf country, according to The Associated Press.

52.title: Wish all your missions are successful: Sidharth on Rashmika's b'day
52.article_body: Actor Sidharth Malhotra, taking to Instagram Stories, wished actress Rashmika Mandanna on her 26th birthday. Sidharth shared a picture with Rashmika and wrote, "Happy birthday Rashmika. Wish all your missions this year are successful. Big hug and love." Sidharth and Rashmika will be seen together in 'Mission Majnu'.

53.title: It’s nice to see them play: Atletico Madrid boss Simeone on Man City
53.article_body: Atletico Madrid manager Diego Simeone on Monday said it is "a joy to watch how Manchester City play" ahead of their UEFA Champions League quarter-final first-leg clash on Tuesday. "What I like about teams like Man City is the effort they put on trying to recover the ball and maintain possession," Simeone said. "It's what all coaches want," he added.

54.title: PM took charge as protector of all Indians: Scindia on 'Operation Ganga'
54.article_body: Praising 'Operation Ganga', Union Minister Jyotiraditya Scindia said on Tuesday that PM Narendra Modi had taken charge as protector of all Indians amid Ukraine crisis. "[I]...received a call at 11:30 pm [and was summoned]...to Delhi, to be sent to Romania [to oversee mission]," he added. Centre had launched 'Operation Ganga' to evacuate Indians from Ukraine amid the Russian invasion.

55.title: I was like 'Who Lata?': Indian composer Ricky on Mangeshkar's call after 1st Grammy win
55.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej, who won his second Grammy award, recalled, "When I won my first Grammy, I got a call from an unknown...number." "I picked up...and a 16-year-old voice tells me 'Hello I'm Lata, is this Ricky?' I'm like 'Who Lata?'," he added. Ricky further said when he realised it was Lata Mangeshkar she started laughing and he apologised.

56.title: UK adds 9 new symptoms of COVID-19 to its official list
56.article_body: Nine new symptoms of COVID-19 have emerged in the UK, two years after the pandemic started. These are: shortness of breath, tiredness, body ache and headache, sore throat, blocked or runny nose, loss of appetite, diarrhoea and feeling sick. UK had earlier recognised three symptoms of COVID-19- fever, new continuous cough and loss of sense of smell or taste.

57.title: US isn't seeking a 'divorce' from China: US trade chief
57.article_body: The US is seeking to realign its commercial ties with China in line with its policies focused on "realignment in the global economy", rather than seek a "divorce", Katherine Tai, the US Trade Representative, said. "I'd focus really on the kinds of changes that we're trying to bring, which are really not about stopping trade or trade divorce," she added.

58.title: 83 rocket launches secured for Amazon's satellite broadband network
58.article_body: Amazon has secured 83 rocket launches over five years to put together a satellite constellation called Project Kuiper to beam broadband internet, the company said on Tuesday. The launch deals were signed with Europe's Arianespace, Jeff Bezos' Blue Origin and United Launch Alliance. Project Kuiper aims to use over 3,000 satellites in low earth orbit to beam high-speed internet.

59.title: US-based Triton to set up ₹10,800 cr EV manufacturing plant in Gujarat
59.article_body: Triton EV has signed a memorandum of understanding (MoU) with the Gujarat government to set up a ₹10,800 crore electric commercial vehicle production plant in Kutch. Initially, ₹1,200 crore will be invested by the company during FY23 for setting up the facility on a 645 acre plot in Bhuj. The unit will have annual production capacity of 50,000 trucks.

60.title: MLC who vacated seat for UP CM in 2017 expelled from BJP for 6 yrs
60.article_body: BJP expelled its sitting MLC Yashwant Singh for six years on Monday, saying that he has been campaigning for his son for Azamgarh-Mau local body authority seat against BJP's candidate. Singh, who was an SP MLC in 2017, had vacated his seat for Yogi Adityanath after he was announced as UP CM. Singh claimed he isn't campaigning for his son.

61.title: Playing IPL 2022 matches in Mumbai is not full-on advantage for MI: Rohit
61.article_body: Five-time champions MI skipper Rohit Sharma said playing IPL 2022 matches in Mumbai's three grounds is not a full-on advantage for his side as except him and Suryakumar Yadav, there are not many players who belong to the city. "Like I said before, it's a relatively new team not many of these guys have played in...climatic conditions of...Mumbai," he stated.

62.title: Ex-cashier jailed for fraudulently exchanging demonetised notes
62.article_body: B Dinesh, former cashier at State Bank of Mysore's Periyapatna branch in Karnataka, has been jailed for seven years for fraudulently exchanging demonetised currency with legal notes worth ₹2.18 crore. Dinesh had also altered the actual denominations written on the deposit slips submitted by customers. He had exchanged notes with a gold jeweller and a pawnbroker identified as Kumar.

63.title: Elon Musk can't own over 14.9% stake in Twitter as its board member
63.article_body: Elon Musk cannot own more than 14.9% of Twitter's common stock as long as he is on the company's board of directors, according to a filing with the US' Securities and Exchange Commission. Musk, who's the world's richest person, was appointed to Twitter's board on Tuesday. He currently holds a stake of 9.2% in Twitter, making him the largest shareholder.

64.title: They threw father's photo, wore slippers on beds: Chirag on eviction
64.article_body: LJP leader Chirag Paswan has claimed that officials who came to evict him from 12, Janpath bungalow threw his father Ram Vilas Paswan's photo. "They walked on the photos with slippers on...they wore slippers all over the beds," he claimed. "This...humiliation for someone you gave the Padma Bhushan," he added. He claimed he was ready to leave by March 20.

65.title: Rapper Kanye West pulls out of Coachella music festival: Report
65.article_body: Rapper Kanye West has reportedly withdrawn from the Coachella music festival days before his performance. Kanye was scheduled to perform on April 17 and April 24. The reason behind the cancellation has not been confirmed yet. However, a source quoted by Page Six has said, "Kanye hasn't been rehearsing or putting on a production."

66.title: We are much better prepared than in the past: Ferrari boss Binotto
66.article_body: Ferrari boss Mattia Binotto said his team are "much better prepared than in the past" to compete for the Formula One world title this season. "For us to be there in the fight, that was our objective to start the season and we can be very pleased," Binotto said. Ferrari's Charles Leclerc won the season-opening Bahrain Grand Prix.

67.title: Meat shops should be closed across country during Navratri: BJP MP
67.article_body: Delhi BJP MP Parvesh Sahib Singh Verma welcomed the South Delhi Mayor's direction for closure of meat shops during Navratri. He said the other two municipal corporations should also follow it and such shops should be closed across India during the festival. "Whether it's Muslim community or others, they should respect it which is what our culture says," Verma added.

68.title: Sri Lankan lawmakers call for formation of interim govt amid crisis
68.article_body: A group of governing party lawmakers in Sri Lanka on Tuesday called for the formation of an interim government amid a severe economic crisis. The group has warned that a failure to appoint the interim government would lead to violence and anarchy in the country. Notably, Sri Lanka's largest opposition party has said that it'll not support any interim government.

69.title: 5 killed, over 10 injured as truck collides with train in Hungary
69.article_body: Authorities on Tuesday said five people were killed and over 10 injured after a truck collided with a train in Mindszent, Hungary. Police said the train derailed from the force of the collision with the truck that was carrying seven workers. Police added five people in the truck were killed and the other two taken to hospital with serious injuries.

70.title: Rajya Sabha passes bill to unify 3 municipal corporations of Delhi
70.article_body: The Rajya Sabha on Tuesday passed the  Delhi Municipal Corporation (Amendment) Bill, 2022, through a voice note. The bill seeks to unify three municipal corporations of Delhi. The bill was tabled in Rajya Sabha by Union Home Minister Amit Shah, who claimed the AAP government in Delhi gave step-motherly treatment to north, south and east Delhi municipal corporations.

71.title: Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore, Juno Temple are my celeb crushes: Daniel
71.article_body: Actor Daniel Radcliffe, when asked about his top three celebrity crushes, named actresses Cameron Diaz, Drew Barrymore and Juno Temple. Talking about Juno, Daniel said, "I've worked with her, she's gorgeous and I wouldn't mind saying her name." Juno and Daniel worked together in the 2014 film 'Horns'. Daniel will next be seen in 'The Lost City'.

72.title: South Africa ends COVID-19 state of disaster, lifts restrictions
72.article_body: South African President Cyril Ramaphosa on Monday said the country will end its national state of disaster introduced in 2020 due to the COVID-19 pandemic at midnight and lift most of its restrictions. "While the pandemic is not over, while the virus remains amongst us, these conditions no longer require we remain in a national state of disaster," he said.

73.title: World's most expensive NFT priced at $400 mn unveiled, buyer to get a yacht
73.article_body: Cyber Yachts, a metaverse yacht company, has unveiled the world's most expensive NFT of a megayacht priced at $400 million. The buyer of the NFT will also receive the real-world, fully-constructed megayacht, the company said. Named "Indah", the 394-foot yacht has 12 cabins, a helicopter landing pad, casino room, gym, and a foredeck hot tub with sunbeds and retractable sunshade.

74.title: Russia to resume flights with 52 'friendly' nations from April 9: PM
74.article_body: Prime Minister Mikhail Mishustin on Monday said Russia will lift COVID-19 restrictions and resume flights between 52 "friendly" countries from April 9. The "friendly" countries like India, Pakistan and China mean nations that have not imposed sanctions following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. Russia has closed its airspace to 36 countries so far, including all 27 members of the European Union.

75.title: US seeks to suspend Russia from UN Human Rights Council
75.article_body: US Ambassador to the UN Linda Thomas-Greenfield said the US will seek to suspend Russia from the UN Human Rights Council. "We believe that the members of the Russian forces committed war crimes in Ukraine, and we believe that Russia needs to be held accountable," Thomas-Greenfield said. "Russia's participation on the Human Rights Council is a farce," she added.

76.title: 99% of world's population breathes poor quality air: WHO
76.article_body: The WHO on Monday said 99% of the world's population breathes air that is unhealthy and does not meet its standard for air quality. The findings are based on studies by over a record 6,000 cities in 117 countries that now monitor air quality. WHO said the air quality is the poorest in its Eastern Mediterranean and Southeast Asia regions.

77.title: Who are the top 10 shareholders of Twitter?
77.article_body: The world's richest person Elon Musk is the largest shareholder of Twitter, owning a 9.2% stake in the platform. Vanguard Group is the second-largest shareholder, with an 8.4% stake, followed by Morgan Stanley Investment Management (8.1%), BlackRock (4.6%) and SSgA Funds Management (4.5%), according to FactSet. Aristotle Capital holds a 2.5% stake and Co-founder Jack Dorsey holds a 2.3% stake.

78.title: China harvesting organs from living prisoners for transplants, research claims
78.article_body: China is suspected of removing organs from living prisoners, claims a research by Australian National University's Mathew Robertson. He found it's likely some prisoners, often from marginalised political groups, are likely to have been operated on while still alive. After analysing data from transplant publications, he found in 71 reports that 'brain death couldn't have properly been declared'.

79.title: I’d go with Pochettino: Rooney backs former Spurs boss for Man Utd job
79.article_body: Former Manchester United player Wayne Rooney said he backs former Tottenham Hotspur boss Mauricio Pochettino to take over as the next Manchester United manager. "I think Pochettino has done it in the Premier League, he knows the Premier League," he said. Rooney won five Premier League titles with Manchester United who are currently seventh on the Premier League table.

80.title: Zaha scores to help Crystal Palace beat Arsenal 3-0 in PL
80.article_body: Wilfried Zaha on Monday scored to help Crystal Palace beat Arsenal 3-0 in the Premier League. Jean-Philippe Mateta and Jordan Ayew gave Palace a 2-0 lead at half-time. "I apologise to our supporters. We didn't have the presence today or the composure to dominate the situation so that is what I'm most annoyed by," Arsenal manager Mikel Arteta said.

81.title: MP govt launches loan scheme to encourage self-employment
81.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan launched Mukhyamantri Udyam Kranti Yojana, a collateral-free loan scheme, on Tuesday to facilitate self-employment among youths. Under it, the state government will provide guarantee on loans of up to ₹50 lakh for self-employment with a subsidy on interest rates. "We will bring up a state-wide startup strategy," Chouhan said.

82.title: Over 600 social media accounts of govt hacked since 2017: Govt
82.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur has said over 600 social media accounts of the central government were hacked since 2017. Thakur said altogether 175 accounts were hacked in 2017, 114 in 2018, 61 in 2019, 77 in 2020, 186 in 2021 and 28 so far this year. He added Indian Computer Emergency Response Team has been established to enhance cyber security.

83.title: Looking forward to working with Twitter CEO Parag: Elon Musk
83.article_body: The world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, Elon Musk, who is joining Twitter's board of directors, on Tuesday tweeted, "Looking forward to working with Parag & Twitter board to make significant improvements to Twitter in coming months!" Twitter's CEO Parag Agrawal welcomed Musk to Twitter's board by saying, "He would bring great value to our Board."

84.title: Truck spills hundreds of McVitie's biscuits on road in UK, pics go viral
84.article_body: Hundreds of McVitie's biscuit boxes were split on a road after they tumbled out of the truck carrying them in the UK. While photos of the incident were widely circulated, Erewash Response on Twitter said, "Please bear with us...whilst we try and 'digest' this issue." A Twitter user wrote, "On my way with a bucket load of tea."

85.title: US dollar reaches over 300 against Sri Lankan rupee for the 1st time
85.article_body: Sri Lanka's local banks said that the US dollar reached over 300 against the Sri Lankan rupee (LKR) for the first time as the nation is facing an economic crisis. Sri Lanka is facing one of its worst economic crises in recent decades with shortage of foreign exchange, which has led to a shortage of fuel and long power cuts.

86.title: EU bans Russian coal imports worth €4 bn per yr in 5th sanctions package amid war
86.article_body: The European Union on Tuesday said it would ban the import of coal from Russia that's worth €4 billion per year, in its fifth sanctions package over the Ukraine war. It also imposed a full transaction ban on four key Russian banks, including Russia's second-largest bank VTB. Russian and Russia-operated vessels have also been banned from accessing EU ports.

87.title: Poland to buy 250 Abrams tanks from US amid conflict in Ukraine
87.article_body: Poland has signed a deal with the US to buy 250 Abrams tanks as it seeks to bolster its defence amid Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The sale of tanks to Poland is another sign of a deep and growing defence relationship with the US, according to Reuters. The US has deployed additional troops in Poland in response to the invasion.

88.title: Will impose sanctions on 9 Russian, 9 Belarusian individuals: Canada
88.article_body: Canada on Monday said it will impose sanctions on nine Russian and nine Belarusian individuals that are close associates of the Russian and Belarusian regimes following Russia's invasion of Ukraine. "By enabling Vladimir Putin's senseless invasion of Ukraine, these close collaborators of the regime are complicit in the horrific events unfolding before our eyes," Foreign Minister Melanie Joly said.

89.title: Court denies bail to 8 men arrested for attack on Delhi CM's house
89.article_body: A Delhi court on Tuesday dismissed the bail plea of eight persons who were arrested for an attack on CM Arvind Kejriwal's residence last week. The court said such protesters had no regard even for court directions which were communicated to them that no protest is allowed at the Chief Minister's house.

90.title: Pic from space shows dead bodies lying on a street in Ukraine
90.article_body: A satellite picture showed dead bodies lying on Yablonska Street in Ukraine's Bucha after Russian invasion. Ukraine accused Russian forces on Sunday of carrying out a "massacre" in the town, one of the towns recaptured by Ukrainian troops as Russia regrouped for battles in eastern Ukraine. Russia denied the allegations, calling them a "provocation" by Ukraine.

91.title: RCB to bowl first against unbeaten RR in their IPL 2022 clash, both teams unchanged
91.article_body: Royal Challengers Bangalore (RCB) captain Faf Du Plessis won the toss and elected to bowl first against unbeaten Rajasthan Royals (RR) in their IPL 2022 clash on Tuesday. Both the teams are unchanged. RCB all-rounder Glenn Maxwell will be eligible to play in IPL 2022 from next match due to Cricket Australia's rules.

92.title: There's slight issue in death bowling of RR: Aakash ahead of RR vs RCB
92.article_body: Ahead of RR-RCB match in IPL 2022, ex-India cricketer Aakash Chopra said there is a "slight issue" in death bowling of current table-toppers RR. "Prasidh Krishna is not your gun death bowler. Trent Boult is a good death bowler, but again, not your gun death pacer," he added. The match will be played today at Wankhede Stadium.

93.title: AIADMK workers protest against property tax hike by Tamil Nadu govt
93.article_body: All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam (AIADMK) workers, including party coordinator O Panneerselvam on Tuesday, protested in Chennai against the hike in property tax announced by the Tamil Nadu government. The protestors demanded that the DMK-led state government roll back the tax increase. Notably, the state government on Sunday proposed a hike of up to 150% in the property tax.

94.title: CM Kejriwal says Delhi's sports policy is built on 3 pillars
94.article_body: Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal, while felicitating Indian Olympians in recognition of their achievements in the Tokyo Olympics, said that Delhi's sports policy is based on three pillars. The first pillar is to establish a sports culture, the second is to identify children with potential and the third is to give financial help to those who brought accolades, Kejriwal said.

95.title: Fire engine damaged after getting caught in manhole fire in Gujarat
95.article_body: A fire engine's door was damaged after it got caught in a fire that broke out from a sewage line and spilled onto the roads from a manhole mouth on the BPC road of Gujarat's Vadodara on Tuesday. "When we started fighting...fire from...first manhole, positive pressure was created on...second cover, which...caused a minor blast and damaged...[the] tender," an official said.

96.title: 29-year-old woman raped inside her house in Gurugram
96.article_body: A 29-year-old woman in Gurugram was allegedly raped inside her house by a man who lives in the same locality on Monday, police said. The accused, who is absconding, had allegedly come to her house to enquire about her husband and then forced himself upon her. The victim later narrated the ordeal to her husband, following which they approached police.

97.title: Delhi Jal Board scraps order allowing 2-hr leave to Muslims during Ramzan
97.article_body: The Delhi Jal Board on Tuesday withdrew its earlier order of giving a short leave, approximately two hours a day, to Muslim employees during the month of Ramzan. The earlier order said they can take leaves till May 2, 2022, or till the date Eid-ul-Fitr is declared. They were asked to complete tasks during the remaining office hours.

98.title: Pune businessman killed after neighbour attacks him with axe
98.article_body: A 34-year-old dairy businessman died after his neighbour allegedly attacked him with an axe in front of his house in Pune on Sunday. According to police, the 35-year-old accused, Ganesh Kharat, had borrowed ₹20,000 from the victim a few days ago and the two had been fighting over the money. Kharat was arrested after the victim's father filed an FIR.

99.title: I'm really happy Elon is joining the Twitter board: Co-founder Jack Dorsey
99.article_body: Twitter Co-founder Jack Dorsey on Tuesday tweeted, "I'm really happy Elon Musk is joining the Twitter board!" Dorsey added, " He cares deeply about our world and Twitter's role in it. Parag Agrawal (Twitter's CEO) and Elon both lead with their hearts, and they will be an incredible team." Musk is Twitter's largest shareholder with a 9.2% stake.

100.title: I did what is right for company: BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer on Grover's exit
100.article_body: Speaking about Ashneer Grover’s exit, BharatPe CEO Suhail Sameer said he did what was right for the company. While mentioning that he and Grover were friends, he said, "We were like very very close…But my job here isn't to be a great friend. My job is to do what's right." Sameer added, "I won't let anything come on my reputation."

101.title: Moldova needs international support to cope with Ukraine crisis: PM
101.article_body: Moldova PM Natalia Gavrilita said on Tuesday that the country requires international support to cope with the influx of refugees from neighbouring Ukraine amid the ongoing Russian invasion. Gavrilita added that Moldova, which is hosting about 1 lakh Ukrainian refugees, requires financial assistance. Germany has said it will aid Moldova in reducing its economic and financial dependence on Russia.

102.title: 3 arrested in Tripura over alleged links with Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen
102.article_body: A joint team of Tripura police and central intelligence officials arrested three persons for their alleged links with Jamaat-ul-Mujahideen Bangladesh (JMB), police said on Tuesday. The suspects were arrested from the Khayokhola area in Sepahijala district on Sunday. Charges against them include waging and attempting to wage war against the Indian government, among others, an official said.

103.title: Not at all: LSG's Krunal Pandya on whether he is missing Hardik Pandya
103.article_body: On being asked whether he is missing his brother, GT captain Hardik Pandya, after having played together for Mumbai Indians, LSG all-rounder Krunal Pandya said, "Not at all." "I genuinely feel like this is my first season of IPL," he said. "I had a great run with Mumbai Indians as well, I had some great memories over there," he added.

104.title: Might have to call Ronaldo as CR7 is at risk now: New world no. 7 Ruud
104.article_body: Norwegian Casper Ruud, who rose to world number seven, said he might have to call Cristiano Ronaldo as "CR7 is at risk" now. "Don't know if we've to do some negotiations and see who can actually have this number," he joked. Ruud has same initials as Ronaldo, who was nicknamed "CR7" after sporting the number seven jersey for Manchester United.

105.title: Delhi Police arrests 106, recover 1081 gms of heroin in last 24 hrs
105.article_body: Delhi Police arrested 106 persons for robbery, snatching, liquor smuggling and recovered 1081 grams of heroin in the last 24 hours, according to data released by their official Twitter account. Moreover, Delhi Police arrested 13 proclaimed offenders, seized 742 litres of illicit liquor and recovered eight stolen vehicles. Emergency help was given on 4,867 calls, the post added.

106.title: 'Give probability of getting fair-skinned bride', says math problem; netizens react
106.article_body: A sample mathematics problem reportedly for ISC students asked them to calculate probability of a man finding a bride with three "qualities"- white complexion, handsome dowry and manners and style. A picture of the same was shared on Twitter and Reddit. "Can't believe this is real," said one user, while another said, "This is so stupid, it made me laugh."

107.title: Malvika enters 2nd round, Prannoy loses at Korea Open 2022
107.article_body: Indian shuttler HS Prannoy lost in first round of men's singles event at 2022 Korea Open Super 500 badminton tournament on Tuesday. The world number 23 lost to 71st-ranked Cheam June Wei of Malaysia 17-21, 7-21 in 41 minutes. Earlier, unseeded Indian Malvika Bansod entered second round of women's singles after defeating world number 24 Han Yue 20-22, 22-20, 21-10.

108.title: Diesel leaks from pipeline during theft & causes fire on Thane road
108.article_body: Diesel leaked from a pipeline when a few people allegedly tried to steal it on Tuesday morning in Thane. The leak caused a fire on the Shil-Mahape road but no casualties were reported. The accused allegedly stole diesel from a pipeline of BPCL passing from Mumbai refinery to Delhi, said an official from Thane Municipal Corporation.

109.title: Gorakhnath Temple attack accused isn't mentally unstable: Doctors
109.article_body: JSP Singh, Superintendent-in-Chief of Netaji Subhash Chandra Bose District Hospital, has claimed that Murtaza Abbasi, who had attacked police officers outside Gorakhnath Temple, isn't mentally unstable. "The accused...was talking coherently, was responding to the queries of doctors and the police and didn't display...violent behaviour," he added. His father had said he suffers from depression.

110.title: Elon Musk to join Twitter's board of directors
110.article_body: Twitter is appointing the world's richest person Elon Musk to its board of directors after he disclosed a passive stake of 9.2% in the company. "He's both a passionate believer and intense critic of the service which is exactly what we need on Twitter, and in the boardroom," Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal tweeted. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

111.title: EVs in Delhi can be charged for free in the noon at 35 spots from June 1
111.article_body: EV owners in Delhi will be able to charge their vehicles for free between 12:00 pm and 3:00 pm from June 1 onwards, ElectriVa Founder Sumit Dhanuka said. The facility will be provided to commercial and non-commercial EVs at around 35 charging stations operational along the Ring Road. "We want to bolster Delhi's EV ecosystem," Dhanuka added.

112.title: Model from Brazil faces divorce from 1 of his 9 wives, says 'I wish to have 10 wives'
112.article_body: Arthur O Urso, a male model from Brazil who went viral after his marriage to nine different women is now facing divorce from one of his wives. He said she wants a divorce because she was "missing a monogamous relationship". However, he added that he plans to marry more women as "his wish has always been to have 10 wives".

113.title: Says a lot about toxic masculinity: Schumer on Will slapping Chris
113.article_body: Comedian Amy Schumer said actor Will Smith slapping presenter Chris Rock at the Oscars 2022 was "really upsetting". "It was just a f***ing bummer...I think it says so much about toxic masculinity," Schumer stated. Schumer, along with Regina Hall and Wanda Sykes, hosted the 94th Academy Awards. It was for the first time that three women hosted the Oscars.

114.title: Russian forces regrouping & preparing offensive in southeast: Ukraine
114.article_body: Russian forces are regrouping and preparing for an offensive in Ukraine's southeast, the Ukrainian military said. The military also said Russian forces aim "to establish full control over" two breakaway regions of Ukraine, which Russia has recognised as independent republics. Russian forces have retreated from northern Ukraine after Russia announced it would shift its focus from Kyiv.

115.title: US crypto billionaire-led FTX may invest in India's MPL: Report
115.article_body: US crypto billionaire Sam Bankman-Fried-led exchange FTX is in talks to invest in Bengaluru-based esports and mobile gaming platform Mobile Premier League (MPL), TechCrunch reported. MPL is looking to get the investment as an extension to its Series E funding at a valuation of $2.5 billion. Last year, MPL turned a unicorn with a $2.3 billion valuation.

116.title: 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese: Report
116.article_body: As many as 51% of women in Hyderabad are either overweight or obese, as per a compendium by the Council for Social Development for 2019-20. Kumuram Bheem Asifabad district had the lowest percentage of women who were overweight or obese in the state in 2019-2020. The compendium has a comprehensive statistical picture of health and demographic status in Telangana.

117.title: Was easier to act with father than to have him as director: Shahid
117.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor, speaking about working with father Pankaj Kapur in the film 'Jersey', said, "It was easier to act with him than to have him as a director." "It was much more relaxed. We used to get time to chill...have a cup of coffee together in between shots," Shahid added. Pankaj had directed Shahid in the 2011 film 'Mausam'.

118.title: Don't spit, disturb others: Pune Metro in etiquette manual for passengers
118.article_body: The Pune Metro has released a pamphlet named 'Metro Etiquettes' which has various directions for the passengers. "Spitting is a crime! It not only makes the place dirty but also can spread contagious diseases," the metro says in the pamphlet. It also asks passengers to keep the metro clean and not disturb other commuters with phone calls and music players.

119.title: Pune law student seeking education loan online cheated of ₹90,000
119.article_body: A 20-year-old Pune law student, seeking an education loan online, was cheated of ₹90,000, police said. The complainant came in contact with the fraudsters after calling on a number posted on a website. She was then asked to make multiple transfers in order to obtain a ₹5 lakh loan. A case has been registered under the IT Act, police added.

120.title: Ex-TCS staff turns part-time Zomato delivery agent, shares post on his challenges
120.article_body: A former TCS employee, Srinivasan Jayaraman's post on challenges he faced as a part-time Zomato delivery agent is being widely circulated. Jayaraman wrote about the inaccuracy of delivery locations of customers and restaurants. He said often phone numbers aren't properly updated and there were cases of long-distance delivery locations. "I salute those who choose this as a career," he said.

121.title: MP police team takes dip in Ganga with handcuffed man, served show-cause notice
121.article_body: A police team from Madhya Pradesh's Burhanpur that had travelled to Uttar Pradesh to arrest a man allegedly took a holy dip in the river Ganga with the handcuffed accused. The officers were served a show-cause notice for dereliction of duty, an officer said. The team should have returned directly to the police station after arresting the accused, he added.

122.title: Govt employees asked to use bicycles for office on Wednesdays in Lakshadweep
122.article_body: The Lakshadweep administration has announced that it'll observe 'Cycle Day' every Wednesday from April 6 and all government employees will have to come to the office on bicycles to beat pollution. Employees with disability or any medical condition will be exempted from this rule, an official order said. Government officials have been asked to not use motor vehicles on Wednesdays.

123.title: Gurugram's max temp to touch 45°C by Sat; IMD issues heatwave alert
123.article_body: IMD has issued a yellow heatwave alert for south Haryana districts, including Gurugram and Faridabad, till April 7. Further, in its weekly forecast, IMD has predicted the maximum temperature in Gurugram is likely to touch 45°C by April 9. Gurugram on Sunday recorded a maximum temperature of 42.3°C, the highest maximum temperature recorded in the city so far this year.

124.title: Ignore, he needs to run his house too: Anupam on Ashish's 'Shark Tank' spoof
124.article_body: Shaadi.com's Founder and Shark Tank India judge Anupam Mittal responded to a fan who said they felt "very bad" about the way Mittal was portrayed in popular YouTuber Ashish Chanchlani's spoof of the show, titled 'Sasta Shaark Tank'. In an Instagram comment, Mittal wrote, "Ignore, use bhi apna ghar chalana hai (Ashish has to run his house too)."

125.title: Over 25,000 foreigners overstayed in India in 2021: Nityanand Rai
125.article_body: As many as 25,143 foreigners overstayed in the country after their visas expired in 2021, Minister of State for Home Affairs Nityanand Rai told Parliament on Tuesday. "The overall number of overstaying foreigners from the period prior to 2019 and up to 31st December 2021 is 3,93,431," Rai said in a written reply.

126.title: After 'Kurup' & 'FIR', Vijay's 'Beast' gets banned in Kuwait: Report
126.article_body: Actor Vijay's film 'Beast' has reportedly been banned by the Ministry of Information in Kuwait. "Reason could be portrayal of Pakistan, terrorists or violence," film trade analyst Ramesh Bala tweeted. Recently, Dulquer Salmaan's 'Kurup' and Vishnu Vishal's 'FIR' were banned in Kuwait. "Kuwait [censorship] is becoming very strict in GCC compared to other countries in the region," Ramesh added.

127.title: US punishing 'disobedient' Imran Khan over Moscow visit: Russia
127.article_body: Amid the ongoing political crisis in Pakistan, the Russian Foreign Ministry issued a statement, accusing the US of intervening in the country's internal affairs. It said that the US decided to punish "disobedient" Imran Khan over his visit to Moscow. Khan met Russian President Vladimir Putin in Moscow on February 24, the day when Russia launched an invasion of Ukraine.

128.title: Krushna trolls Archana for not being part of The Kapil Sharma Show's US tour
128.article_body: Archana Puran Singh shared a video with comedian-actor Krushna Abhishek, where he teases her for not joining 'The Kapil Sharma' team on their US tour. "Archana ji ko nahi le ke jaa rahe." (We aren't taking Archana ji). Reacting to it, Archana jokingly said they aren't taking her to save money. She captioned the video, "Behind the scenes masti (fun)."

129.title: Denmark expels 15 Russian diplomats over security concerns
129.article_body: Denmark on Tuesday expelled 15 Russian 'intelligence officers' it said were serving as diplomats. "We will not accept...Russian intelligence officers...spying on Danish soil," Danish Foreign Minister Jeppe Kofod said. Notably, the move comes amid reports of atrocities by Russian troops in Ukraine's Bucha, following which, Italy, Germany and France announced expulsion of several Russian diplomats.

130.title: Making coffee easier than bowling in powerplay in India: RCB's Willey
130.article_body: Asked to choose between making coffee and bowling in the powerplay in India, RCB all-rounder David Willey said the former is easier. Willey, who was bought by the Bengaluru-based franchise for ₹2 crore, registered bowling figures of 3-0-28-0 and 2-0-7-0 in his side's two matches so far in IPL 2022. RCB will face RR today at Wankhede Stadium, Mumbai.

131.title: European Commission Prez to visit Kyiv this week to meet Zelenskyy
131.article_body: European Commission President Ursula von der Leyen will travel to Kyiv this week for a meeting with Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy, an European Union (EU) spokesman tweeted on Tuesday. She will be accompanied by EU's top diplomat Josep Borrell on the trip. European Parliament President Roberta Metsola had visited Kyiv last week.

132.title: Hyd civic body launches scheme offering 5% rebate on property tax
132.article_body: Greater Hyderabad Municipal Corporation has launched an early bird scheme through which people can avail a 5% rebate on property tax. Municipal Administration Department's Director N Satyanarayana said the scheme will apply to those who pay property tax by April 30. Reportedly, GHMC received ₹13.9 crore in two days from 34,540 people who paid property taxes online through the scheme.

133.title: Will hold such events across Maha: Aaditya at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave
133.article_body: Maharashtra Environment Minister Aaditya Thackeray, while speaking at Pune Alternate Fuel Conclave, on Tuesday said more such events will be held across the state. "The green industry is going to take a huge jump and we can lead the world in that. Creating revenue for our country and jobs for people," Thackeray said at the conclave.

134.title: TN Cong leader, who said Rahul & Priyanka should step aside, sacked
134.article_body: Tamil Nadu Congress spokesperson Americai V Narayanan, who said Rahul Gandhi and Priyanka Gandhi should step aside to save Congress, has been sacked, reports said on Tuesday. "I love Rahul Gandhi but unfortunately, he has not delivered," he said. He also urged Congress to bring back former leaders like Mamata Banerjee, Jagan Mohan Reddy, Sharad Pawar and K Chandrashekar Rao.

135.title: RRR writer Vijayendra says film will have possible sequel: Sreenivasa
135.article_body: Telugu film producer Sreenivasa Kumar, who attended the success party of 'RRR', took to Twitter and said the 'RRR' writer KV Vijayendra Prasad has hinted at the film's sequel. "'RRR' will be a franchise and possible sequel says writer Vijayendra," Sreenivasa tweeted. The success party, attended by Jr NTR and Ram Charan, was hosted by producers Dil Raju and Shirish.

136.title: Rohit has been a fun captain in IPL: MI all-rounder Tim David
136.article_body: Talking about Rohit Sharma, MI all-rounder Tim David said he's been a fun captain in IPL 2022. "I've only played two games with him, so just getting used to playing with him. Getting used to playing with lots of guys in the team, but we'll find our feet," he added. MI have two losses from two matches so far.

137.title: 2 men steal 15 Llyod ACs from Ahmedabad godown, arrested
137.article_body: Two men have been arrested by the Ahmedabad Police's Detection of Crime Branch (DCB) for stealing 15 air conditioners from a factory godown in Naroda. Police said that the accused Sabyasachi Pal and Mehul More, both 20-years-old, were arrested with a rickshaw that had the air conditioners that they had stolen in November last year.

138.title: MP CM launches scheme to give loans up to ₹50 lakh for self-employment
138.article_body: Madhya Pradesh CM Shivraj Singh Chouhan on Tuesday launched the 'Udyam Kranti Yojana' in order to facilitate self-employment for the youth. Under the scheme, a loan guarantee of ₹1 lakh to ₹50 lakh will be provided with subsidies on interest rate for self-employment. Around one lakh youth are expected to benefit from the scheme in the financial year 2022-23.

139.title: Fuel price hike in India is 1/10th of price hike in other countries: HS Puri
139.article_body: Fuel prices hike in India is one-tenth of the price hike in other countries, Petroleum Minister HS Puri said in the Lok Sabha on Tuesday. "Comparing gasoline (petrol) prices between April 2021 and March 22, the prices in the US have increased by 51%, Canada 52%, Germany 55%, UK 55%, France 50%, Spain 58% but in India 5%," said Puri.

140.title: 2 held for threatening gay man with his sex video in Coimbatore
140.article_body: Two private college students were arrested for allegedly extorting money from a man by making him involved in a homosexual act and recording it in Coimbatore. According to the police, the accused, aged 19 and 22, had snatched a mobile phone and cash from the complainant. They also threatened to circulate the sex video if the complainant approached the police.

141.title: Wasn't allowed to put lipstick, thought life will be set on becoming actor: Rupali
141.article_body: Actress Rupali Ganguly said that her mother was strict and did not allow the actress to wear lipstick. She added that wearing lipstick was a big deal for her and she thought her life would be set if she became an actor. She added that she thought the director and other crew members worked hard and actors have it easy.

142.title: Bharti documents her baby's birth journey, fan says 'You're a strong woman'
142.article_body: Comedienne-host Bharti Singh and her husband Haarsh Limbachiyaa, who welcomed their son on Sunday, shared a video on their YouTube channel LOL (Life of Limbachiyaa's). In the video, Bharti documented her baby's entire birth journey starting from when they went to the doctor to the last day of Bharti's pregnancy. Reacting to it, a user commented, "You're a strong woman."

143.title: Shot for a difficult climax right after my cancer treatment: Sanjay on KGF 2
143.article_body: Ahead of the release of 'KGF 2', actor Sanjay Dutt spoke about the "difficult climax" he shot right after his cancer treatment. "The climax had to be mounted on a large scale. It was a difficult climax, there was mud, dust, fire and a lot of action," Sanjay said. He added that the makers did everything to make him comfortable.

144.title: India has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population at present: Govt
144.article_body: Health Minister Mansukh Mandaviya on Tuesday said India, at present, has 1.96 nurses per 1,000 population with 33.41 lakh registered nursing personnel. He added that the country's doctor-population ratio is 1:834 with 13.01 lakh allopathic doctors and 5.65 lakh AYUSH doctors. Undergraduate seats in medical colleges have increased from 51,348 before 2014 to 89,875 in 2022, he added.

145.title: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles arrive at 2 major nesting sites in Odisha
145.article_body: Over 10 lakh Olive Ridley turtles have arrived at two major mass nesting sites in Odisha this year. According to officials, a record of over 5.5 lakh turtles congregated at Rushikulya estuary, whereas around five lakh turtles arrived at Gahirmatha Marine Sanctuary in Kendrapara. "We can't say why more turtles preferred Rushikulya rookery. It's a natural phenomenon," an official said.

146.title: Omicron sub-variant BA.2 makes up 72% of COVID cases in US: CDC
146.article_body: Omicron BA.2 sub-variant now makes up 72.2% of the COVID cases in the US, up from nearly 57.3% in the past week, the Centers for Disease Control and Prevention (CDC) said. However, the overall COVID-19 infections in America have dropped sharply after hitting record levels in January. According to WHO, BA.2 now makes up about 86% of all cases globally.

147.title: Delhi govt's step-motherly behaviour hinders working of 3 MCDs: Shah
147.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah on Tuesday alleged that the Delhi government's "step-motherly behaviour" hinders the efficient working of all three municipal corporations. "If state governments behave in a step-motherly fashion with civic bodies, neither Panchayati Raj nor urban local bodies will be successful," Shah added. He was speaking in Rajya Sabha on the Bill to merge the civic bodies.

148.title: Kashmir Files crosses ₹300 cr at worldwide box office, director shares post
148.article_body: Filmmaker Vivek Ranjan Agnihotri's 'The Kashmir Files' has earned ₹331 crore at the worldwide box office. He took to Twitter on Monday to share the news and wrote, "Thanks to all Indians all over the world in helping #TheKashmirFiles tell the truth to the world." It stars Mithun Chakraborty, Pallavi Joshi and Anupam Kher among others in pivotal roles.

149.title: Nobody pushing Pant to get ton in ODIs; 40s, 50s are fine: Rathour
149.article_body: Team India batting coach Vikram Rathour said nobody is pushing Rishabh Pant to get a century in ODIs, terming it as fine if he can consistently score 40s, 50s. "Nobody wants him not to play his shots, we just want him to be more selective in picking the bowlers," added Rathour. Pant is yet to score his maiden ODI ton.

150.title: Hope Williamson will play in the England Test series: NZ coach Gary Stead
150.article_body: New Zealand coach Gary Stead said he is hopeful of captain Kane Williamson featuring in the Test series against England in June but emphasises being "smart" while managing his workload. "He's (Williamson) dying to play cricket for New Zealand...but we can't burn him out...We have to be smart around those things," Stead said while referring to Williamson's recent elbow injury.

151.title: Hybrid security to be evolved at establishments where CISF is deployed: Govt
151.article_body: The Centre informed the Lok Sabha that hybrid models of security will be evolved to provide security at establishments where the Central Industrial Security Force (CISF) is deployed. "There is no proposal under consideration to train and certify private security agencies across the country by CISF," MoS for Home Nityanand Rai said.

152.title: Petrol prices reach ₹110.25/litre in B'luru as fuel rates hiked again
152.article_body: Fuel prices were hiked again across the country for the 13th time in 15 days on Tuesday. Following the latest price revision, the price of petrol has reached ₹110.25 per litre in Bengaluru, while that of diesel has reached ₹94.01 per litre. Meanwhile, Karnataka Electricity Regulatory Commission has hiked electricity tariffs by five paise per unit across the state.

153.title: After SRK & Sanjay, Notebook actor Zaheer Iqbal receives UAE's Golden Visa
153.article_body: Zaheer Iqbal, who was seen in Salman Khan-backed film 'Notebook', took to Instagram to announce that he has received the UAE's Golden Visa. The visa will stay valid for 10 years and will allow him to work and live in the country without a national sponsor. Actors who've been granted Golden Visa include Shah Rukh Khan, Sanjay Dutt and Mammootty.

154.title: I have seen bodies frozen due to being burned: Ram Charan on Russia-Ukraine war
154.article_body: Actor Ram Charan said he has seen bodies frozen due to being burned in videos sent by Rusty, who was his security-in-charge while shooting for 'RRR' in Ukraine. "The videos were dreadful. If you touch [the bodies] probably they will turn into ashes," added Ram. "Rusty burst out crying," stated Ram. "I keep texting him...to pep him up," said Ram.

155.title: Indian pair of Manika, Archana enter top 5 in TT world rankings
155.article_body: India's women's doubles pair of Manika Batra and Archana Girish Kamath have moved up to the fourth spot (women's doubles category) in the latest world rankings issued by the International Table Tennis Federation. The two places' jump in the world rankings is due to the duo's performance in the WTT Star Contender Doha 2022 where they won a bronze medal.

156.title: 99% of world’s population now breathes polluted air: WHO
156.article_body: Almost the entire global population is breathing polluted air, the World Health Organization (WHO) warned on Monday. The WHO data revealed that 99% of people in the world are inhaling unhealthy levels of fine particulate matter and nitrogen dioxide (NO2) that threaten their health. People living in low and middle-income countries have been suffering the highest exposures, the data stated.

157.title: Videos of Zakir Naik found in laptop of Gorakhnath temple attacker: Police
157.article_body: The UP Police's Anti-Terrorism Squad found videos of radical Muslim preacher Zakir Naik and violence in Syria in the laptop recovered from the 29-year-old man who attacked two policemen outside Gorakhnath temple on Sunday. The attack is a part of a "serious conspiracy" and could be termed a "terror incident" based on evidence collected so far, the police added.

158.title: Rachakonda Police seizes 46,500 litres of illegal diesel, arrests 6
158.article_body: The official Twitter handle of Rachakonda Police shared that an illegal diesel mafia has been busted in the city. The post further said that police has arrested six persons and seized 46,500 litres of illegal diesel from their possession. Notably, the price of petrol has reached ₹118.59 per litre in Hyderabad, while that of diesel has reached ₹104.62 per litre.

159.title: Once wanted to make Rohit bhai happy, he abused me on the field: Ishan Kishan
159.article_body: MI wicketkeeper-batter Ishan Kishan revealed he once wanted to make captain Rohit Sharma happy by trying to make the ball old by rolling it on ground during a match in his first IPL season. "I rolled it...but there was dew...He took out his towel and abused me," Ishan said. "He later said, 'Don't take it personally...it's just match-to-match'," he added.

160.title: Won't get scared even if I'm shot: Raut as ED attaches his properties
160.article_body: Senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut on Tuesday said he won't get scared even if he is shot or sent to jail. His reaction came after ED attached properties linked to him in connection to an alleged ₹1,034 land scam case. He claimed he doesn't even own one acre of land in Alibaug and purchased properties with his hard-earned money.

161.title: Becoming someone on whom one can rely: KL Rahul on Deepak Hooda
161.article_body: Lucknow Super Giants skipper KL Rahul has said that Deepak Hooda is "becoming" a reliable middle-order batter after the latter scored 51 runs off 33 balls against the Sunrisers Hyderabad on Monday. "I've been playing with Hooda for the last 3-4 seasons...He had to wait for his chance...and now is becoming someone you can rely on," Rahul said.

162.title: Airbnb clarifies it's not suspending Russians from making reservations
162.article_body: Airbnb has clarified that it's not banning Russian and Belarusian nationals from making reservations on its platform. Earlier, the platform had said guests located in Russia or Belarus will not be able to make new reservations on Airbnb. Some users interpreted the statement, which was made in Russian, to mean the policy applied to all Russian and Belarusian nationals globally.

163.title: Fish can perform addition and subtraction, finds study
163.article_body: Cichlid and stingray fish species can perform simple calculations in numbers ranging from one to five, a study stated. Researchers trained them to perform simple additions and subtractions by increasing or decreasing an initial value by one. They can also be trained to detect smaller quantities without counting. It's, however, not known what these fish need their mathematical abilities for.

164.title: Mesmerising sight: Aaditya Thackeray on Pune college's boat show
164.article_body: Maharashtra Minister Aaditya Thackeray said the 94th Regatta (boat show) organised by the College of Engineering Pune (COEP) was "a mesmerising sight". "It's a fantastic event with a mix of sports and grace," Thackeray said. "Wow, so nice to see a regatta after so many years. Once upon a time, I was also a participant," a Twitter user commented.

165.title: Undermines women empowerment: NCW on textbook listing merits of dowry
165.article_body: The National Commission for Women (NCW) has written to Education Minister Dharmendra Pradhan seeking remedial action against the sociology textbook for nurses which listed merits of dowry. Calling dowry a social evil in India, NCW said portraying it in a positive way would undermine women empowerment. "It sends very wrong message to...students about prevailing menace of dowry," the NCW said.

166.title: My father went to hospital to get his BP checked: Ishan Kishan on IPL 2018 auction
166.article_body: Recalling IPL 2018 auction wherein he was bought by MI for ₹6.2 crore, Ishan Kishan said when he went home after receiving the news, his father wasn't there. "I asked my mother, 'Where is dad?' She said, 'He has gone to hospital to get his BP checked'," Ishan said. "I was thinking 'What has happened to my family?'" Ishan added.

167.title: US author who wrote 'How to murder your husband' essay accused of killing husband
167.article_body: A 71-year-old US-based romance novelist is accused of fatally shooting her husband in June 2018 to get more than $1.5 million in life insurance. Nancy Crampton-Brophy had written an essay entitled 'How to murder your husband' in 2011. "The thing I know about murder is that everyone...has it in him/her (to murder) when pushed far enough," the essay reportedly said.

168.title: Elephants can dance as well: HDFC Bank's CEO on merger with HDFC
168.article_body: HDFC Bank's CEO Sashidhar Jagdishan, who will lead the merged entity of HDFC Bank and HDFC, said, "Elephants can dance as well." When asked about the next milestone, Jagdishan said, "We don't work for any milestones." He added, "Even if I'm not there...this engine created by the founding fathers...it's such a fantastic platform that it will grow on its own."

169.title: Yami shares jail inmate's story who prepared career options for his daughter
169.article_body: Actress Yami Gautam, who'll be seen as a cop in 'Dasvi', shared the story of a jail inmate that stayed with her. She said, "One inmate...sent his register...for an autograph and with a picture of his daughter." Yami added that he prepared different career options in the register for his daughter including that of an IAS officer and a banker.

170.title: Had released 'Aankhen' with 2 different endings in India & abroad: Director
170.article_body: Vipul Shah's directorial 'Aankhen', which featured Amitabh Bachchan, Akshay Kumar and Sushmita Sen, has completed 20 years of its release today.  Vipul revealed that they had released the film with "two different endings in India and abroad". "Overseas print had an open-end...I was told, India isn't ready for such open-ended stories as...concept of sequel didn't exist back then," he added.

171.title: Maxwell won't play vs RR due to Cricket Australia's clause: RCB coach Hesson
171.article_body: RCB head coach Mike Hesson has said Australia all-rounder Glenn Maxwell won't be available for their match against RR on Tuesday and will only be available from their next game onwards. Hesson explained that while Maxwell has joined the camp, he can't play before Australia complete their tour of Pakistan. Australia will play their last T20I against Pakistan on Tuesday.

172.title: Blessed it happened when young as I can recover: Hooda on Krunal spat
172.article_body: Discussing his spat with Krunal Pandya while playing for Baroda in 2021, Deepak Hooda said, "I am blessed that it all happened at a young age because then you can recover as well [as] learn a lot." Both Hooda and Krunal are representing LSG in IPL 2022. They were seen hugging each other in LSG's IPL 2022 opener against GT.

173.title: Italy expels 30 Russian diplomats citing security concerns
173.article_body: Italy reportedly expelled 30 Russian diplomats citing security concerns amid the ongoing war in Ukraine. "The measure is in agreement with other European and Atlantic partners and is necessary for reasons linked to our national security," said the country's Foreign Minister Luigi Di Maio. The Italian government reportedly summoned the Russian ambassador to inform him about the expulsion.

174.title: ByteDance scraped content from Instagram, Snapchat for older app: Report
174.article_body: TikTok-parent ByteDance made fake accounts with content scraped from Instagram, Snapchat and other such platforms and used them on Flipagram, a TikTok predecessor, in 2017, BuzzFeed News reported citing four former employees of the company. The scraping was seen as a "growth hack" for the company. ByteDance's goal was to scrape more than 10,000 videos a day, a source said.

175.title: 13-yr-old girl writes poems on death, dies by suicide in Maha
