175.article_body: A 13-year-old girl died by suicide at her residence in Maharashtra's Nagpur after writing poems and quotes on death, police said on Tuesday. Police found a notebook in her bedroom, in which she had been writing poems on death in Marathi and English for the last two months. The incident occurred at 1 pm on Monday, reports said.

176.title: Hungary PM must choose between Russia & other world: Zelenskyy
176.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said Hungarian PM Viktor Orban will have to choose between Moscow and the "other world" following his election victory on Sunday. Zelenskyy accused Orban of fearing Russian influence. Orban has for years maintained close ties with Russian President Vladimir Putin. The Russian leader had also congratulated Orban after his party won a fourth term in office.

177.title: 4 arrested in UP for posing as magistrates and trying to see question papers
177.article_body: The Agra Police arrested four people who entered a school posing as magistrates and sought to inspect a secure room where question papers of UP Board examinations were kept, an official said. "They asked police and centre manager to take them to strong room...When asked, they were not able to prove their identity and provide authorisation letter," the police informed.

178.title: Germany warns its Russian speakers of disinformation on Ukraine war
178.article_body: Germany has warned Russian speakers in the country against Kremlin's 'disinformation' amid the ongoing Russian invasion of Ukraine. Russian speakers in Germany should "inform themselves comprehensively with national and international media", German government official Wolfgang Büchner said. His remarks came after Kremlin alleged that the killing of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha had been staged.

179.title: Woman recovers from vertebra fracture after neurosurgery in Hyd
179.article_body: The doctors at Hyderabad's Century Hospital successfully performed minimal invasive neurosurgery to help a 60-year-old woman recover from a fracture in the lower vertebra. She was reportedly suffering from severe back pain after a fall incident. The doctors performed a vertebroplasty procedure on her, under which bone cement is injected into the backbones (vertebrae) that have cracked or broken.

180.title: Bird population in tropical forests drops by 90% in 40 years: Study
180.article_body: According to research, the number of birds living in tropical forests declined by up to 90% in the last 40 years. Researchers recorded a decline in the number of 40 species amounting to 70% of the total bird population. Moreover, 35 species declined to at least half of their initial numbers. Only the hummingbird and puffbird populations saw a rise.

181.title: Indian composer Ricky Kej touches co-winner's feet at Grammys, Raveena praises him
181.article_body: Indian composer Ricky Kej won his second Grammy when he and collaborator Stewart Copeland won Best New Age Album at 64th Annual Grammy Awards. Actress Raveena Tandon shared a video where Ricky is seen touching Stewart's feet on stage. "So so proud. Brings the divinity of our culture on an international stage...Pays respect to his guru. #proudtobeindian," she wrote.

182.title: Nagaland's 1st woman Rajya Sabha MP takes oath in traditional attire, jewellery
182.article_body: S Phangnon Konyak, the President of BJP Nagaland Mahila Morcha, took oath in the Rajya Sabha wearing her traditional Naga clothes and jewellery on Monday. She is the first woman from the state to get a berth in Parliament's Upper House. The 44-year-old leader was elected unopposed as the Rajya Sabha member from Nagaland on March 31.

183.title: Water cannons used on AAP water tariff hike protesters in Chandigarh
183.article_body: The police on Tuesday used water cannons to disperse a protest against the increase in water tariff in Chandigarh by AAP workers. The party tweeted a video of the incident and accused the BJP of making things costlier after "fraudulently" getting a Mayor of the BJP party. The protesters had been moving towards the Union Territory's Municipal Corporation office.

184.title: All practices in compliance with law: Zomato after CCI orders probe
184.article_body: Zomato issued a statement after the Competition Commission of India ordered an investigation into the conduct of Swiggy and Zomato. It said while CCI has prima facie didn't find concerns with respect to their independence on levy of commissions or alleged bundling of services, it'll work to assist them and explain why their services are in compliance with the law.

185.title: 10,600 km road network ready in Naxal-hit areas: Nityanand Rai
185.article_body: Union Minister of State for Home Nityanand Rai said 10, 600 kilometres of roads have been constructed in Left Wing Extremism (LWE) or Naxal-affected areas at an expenditure of around ₹13,000 crore. Over 16,200 kilometres of roads have been approved in such areas, he added. "The number of districts reporting violence...reduced...from 96% in 2010 to 46% in 2021," Rai added.

186.title: Tamil Nadu man builds ₹80,000 statue of his dog who died last year
186.article_body: An 82-year-old retired government employee has built a statue in the memory of his dog named Tom who died in 2021 in the Sivaganga district of Tamil Nadu. The man has spent ₹80,000 on the statue. "Tom was with me since 2010 but he died in 2021," the man said, adding that they offer food to the statue.

187.title: Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh is unconstitutional: Cong’s Deepender Hooda
187.article_body: Congress leader Deepender Singh Hooda termed Punjab’s resolution on Chandigarh as "unconstitutional". "The resolution of Punjab over Chandigarh is in violation of the Act under which Punjab, Haryana and Himachal Pradesh were formed in the year 1966," Hooda said. "Punjab has suppressed the water of Haryana’s share, even after the Supreme Court’s decision in favour of Haryana," Hooda stated.

188.title: 3 booked for abetting suicide of 23-yr-old man in Gurugram
188.article_body: The Government Railway Police (GRP) on Monday said that three men have been booked for abetting the suicide of a 23-year-old man in Gurugram. The man had jumped in front of a train on April 2, according to the police. The victim's family has claimed that he killed himself after being forced into peddling drugs by the accused.

189.title: Bombay HC asks Ola, Uber to comply with Motor Vehicle Aggregator Guidelines
189.article_body: The Bombay High Court directed the cab aggregators, including Uber India and Ola, to comply with the conditions laid down in the Motor Vehicle Aggregator Guidelines (MVAG) 2020. The court's directions were given to those firms that have been granted provisional licenses. The bench said that the MVAG-2020 will be applicable until the Maharashtra Regulation of Aggregator Rules-2021 is approved.

190.title: Even Sachin took time to score his first ODI ton: Kiran More on Pant
190.article_body: Talking about Rishabh Pant who is yet to score his maiden century in ODIs, ex-India wicketkeeper Kiran More said even Sachin Tendulkar took time to score his maiden ODI hundred. "There will be times when you smash your head and say, 'Why did Pant play that shot?', but...we need to be ready to accept that," Rohit Sharma had recently said.

191.title: NTR30 is loaded with drama, will live up post RRR expectations: Jr NTR
191.article_body: Jr NTR, talking about his upcoming film with director Koratala Siva, said, "It's going to be loaded with drama because...drama sells a lot." Jr NTR's film with Koratala is tentatively named 'NTR30'. He added 'NTR30' will have everything that the audience expects after the release of 'RRR'. Speaking about 'NTR31' with director Prashanth Neel, he called it a wonderful project.

192.title: Figuring out how MS Dhoni's mind works really stressed me out: Kishan
192.article_body: Ishan Kishan said he keeps trying to figure out how MS Dhoni's mind works, adding that attempting to do so really stressed him out in an IPL match. "I was playing well...But then Dhoni bhai walked up to the bowler and said something. And in my mind, I'm wondering what Dhoni bhai has told him," stated Kishan.

193.title: Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara to invest ₹18 cr in US-based Bitkraft Ventures
193.article_body: Rakesh Jhunjhunwala-backed Nazara Technologies will invest over ₹18 crore in US-based game fund Bitkraft Ventures. Nazara will invest ₹6.5 crore upfront, while the balance investment amount of ₹12.2 crore will be deployed over a period of three years. Earlier in March, Nazara Technologies had announced its commitment to invest ₹30 crore into Griffin Gaming Partners' Fund ll.

194.title: HAL hands over first set of Gaganyaan hardware to ISRO
194.article_body: Hindustan Aeronautics Limited (HAL) on Monday handed over the first set of Gaganyaan hardware to Indian Space Research Organisation (ISRO) in Bengaluru. "HAL has and will continue to play a significant role in India's current and future space programme including the Gaganyaan manned mission to space, given the skills and knowledge base within the company," said ISRO Chairman S Somanath.

195.title: Mumbai man sexually abuses 4 minor boys after offering money for 'falooda'
195.article_body: A 30-year-old man was arrested for allegedly sexually abusing four minor boys in Mumbai between March 24 and 31. Police said the man allegedly lured the boys under the pretext of giving them each ₹50 to have 'falooda' (dessert). The accused, who is a relative of one of the boys, allegedly took the nine-year-old to his room and molested him.

196.title: Military situation in Mariupol is very difficult: Ukraine Prez
196.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy said that the military situation in the southern port city of Mariupol is "very difficult". Zelenskyy added that Turkey had proposed a plan to help evacuate injured people and dead bodies from the city, but warned the initiative depended on his Russian counterpart Vladimir Putin's will. Reportedly, around 1,30,000 people are stuck in Mariupol.

197.title: ED attaches assets worth ₹4.8 crore linked to AAP's Satyendar Jain
197.article_body: Enforcement Directorate (ED) has attached assets worth ₹4.81 crore linked to Delhi Minister and AAP leader Satyendar Jain in a disproportionate assets case. The investigation revealed that during 2015-16, certain companies beneficially owned and controlled by Jain received accommodation entries from shell companies against cash transferred through hawala route. Further investigation is underway.

198.title: PM asks BJP lawmakers to create awareness about govt schemes
198.article_body: PM Narendra Modi has asked ruling BJP lawmakers to attend the fortnight-long programmes from April 7 to create awareness about the government’s "social justice" and "people-centric" policies. A BJP functionary said the lawmakers and ministers have been asked to create awareness about 14 central schemes at the local level.

199.title: Mumbai man injured in fight over parking spot, gets 20 stitches
199.article_body: A man in Mumbai received as many as 20 stitches after getting involved in a fight over a parking spot for a two-wheeler on Friday in Mumbai's Santacruz. "The fight started after one Imtiyaz Baig asked Farhan Sheikh to remove his motorcycle from the lane, with families of both men getting involved," police said. Two brothers have been arrested.

200.title: 5 killed, several injured as van crashes into train in Hungary
200.article_body: Five people were killed and at least 10 injured on Tuesday after a van crashed into a train in Hungary. The authorities said all of the deceased victims were travelling in the van. The train, with 22 people onboard, derailed due to the collision. They added that the van carrying local workers drove onto the tracks while ignoring red lights.

201.title: 3 killed, 30 injured as double-decker bus overturns in UP; CM expresses grief
201.article_body: Three persons were killed and 30 sustained injuries when a double-decker bus overturned on the Lucknow-Gorakhpur national highway in Uttar Pradesh on Tuesday morning while trying to overtake another vehicle, police said. CM Yogi Adityanath has expressed condolences to the bereaved families. He also directed speedy relief and rescue efforts by sending the District Magistrate and SSP to the spot.

202.title: If you don't get Buttler out early, he'll take the game away: Morkel
202.article_body: Ahead of RR's match against RCB, ex-SA pacer Morne Morkel said RR batter Jos Buttler is one of those batters who'll take the game away if you don't get him out early in the match. "Sometimes the bowling unit needs to say it's his day and enjoy the show," added Morkel. Buttler scored 100(68) in RR's last game against MI.

203.title: Russia says Wikipedia could be fined over 'false' info on Ukraine
203.article_body: Russia has said that Wikipedia can be fined up to $48,120 for failing to remove "material with inaccurate information of public interest" about the situation in Ukraine. Earlier, the Wikimedia Foundation said it will "not back down" after Russia threatened to block Wikipedia's Russian-language site covering Ukraine's invasion. It said Russia's takedown request threatens censorship.

204.title: PWD to install LED lights on 8.5 km stretch from Mayapuri to Moti Bagh
204.article_body: Delhi's Public Works Department has decided to remove the dark spots on an 8.5 kilometre stretch from Mayapuri to Moti Bagh junction with high-tech automatic LED lights. "The stretch will have cycle tracks. Music speakers have been installed so more people use this stretch and women do not feel unsafe," said a senior PWD official.

205.title: Officials seek 5 new lifts, 2 ramps at Pune railway station
205.article_body: Pune's railway division officials have sent a proposal to railway headquarters seeking installation of five lifts and two ramps at station for convenience of disabled and elderly commuters. According to proposal, two lifts will be installed on first platform, while the rest will be installed on five other platforms. The ramps will be attached to a newly-constructed foot-over-bridge at station.

206.title: Dearness Allowance for Karnataka govt employees hiked by 2.75% to 27.25%
206.article_body: The Karnataka government on Tuesday announced a 2.75% hike in the Dearness Allowance (DA) payable to its employees in the revised 2018 pay scales and under the seventh pay commission. Employees will now get 27.25% DA with effect from January 1 this year. This comes days after PM Narendra Modi approved a 3% hike in DA for central government employees.

207.title: Girl named 'Madhu ka Panchwa Baccha' on Aadhaar denied school admission in UP
207.article_body: A girl in Uttar Pradesh was denied admission to a government school as her Aadhaar card carried her name as "Madhu ka Panchwa Baccha" and "Baby Five of Madhu". While a photo of her card went viral online, the District Magistrate said it was a mistake caused by gross negligence and strict action will be taken against those involved.

208.title: Kangana loses cool at paparazzi for waiting outside her home, says 'Stop it'
208.article_body: Kangana Ranaut lost her cool at paparazzi, who were waiting outside her home to click her pictures. In a video shared by a paparazzo on Instagram, Kangana can be seen getting out of her car. However, she declined to pose for the shutterbugs and asked them to leave. She said, "Will you come here every day now? Stop it."

209.title: Row over loudspeakers at mosques will backfire BJP in elections: Siddaramaiah
209.article_body: Ex-Karnataka CM Siddaramaiah criticised the BJP-led Karnataka government and said that the Karnataka BJP is "manipulating society with communal issues for their political gains" because the Assembly elections are nearing. "This will backfire BJP in coming days. Speakers are installed in temples, mosques and churches for a long time now. What harm did it cause to people?" Siddaramaiah added.

210.title: Maha BJP leader offers to fund speakers to counter Azaan with Hanuman Chalisa
210.article_body: Maharashtra BJP leader Mohit Kamboj has offered to fund speakers to counter Azaan with Hanuman Chalisa. "Anyone who needs a loudspeaker...can ask us for free!" he said. This comes after MNS leader Raj Thackeray urged the state government to remove loudspeakers from mosques and added that if it was not done, he would play Hanuman Chalisa on speakers.

211.title: 18-year-old gamer claims headphones saved him from a bullet in US
211.article_body: An 18-year-old gamer from the US claimed on Reddit that his headphones saved his life from a stray bullet. "A stray bullet went through my window and hit the headphones on top of my head," the teenager's post read. "If it wasn't for the headphones made with good quality I would've been a dead kid at 18," the post said.

212.title: Group sex video of female teacher & her students recorded by her lover in TN; arrested
212.article_body: Tamil Nadu Cyber cell has launched an investigation into a group sex video involving a 42-year-old female school teacher and boy students. The video, which was allegedly filmed by a 39-year-old  businessman who was the teacher's lover, had reportedly been shared by his friends. The teacher and her lover have been arrested.

213.title: Even your husband won't be as proud as I am: Satish to Rupali on 'Anupamaa'
213.article_body: Actor Satish Shah said that he is proud of actress Rupali Ganguly for her performance in 'Anupamaa'. "Even your husband or any other family member won't be as proud as me...this is coming straight from my heart...I swear Rupali darling...you are doing...fantastic job...I always knew you were...very fine actor when you had joined us in Sarabhai Vs Sarabhai," Satish added.

214.title: Oscar-winning filmmaker John Zaritsky passes away at 79
214.article_body: Oscar-winning filmmaker John Zaritsky passed away aged 79 on March 30 due to heart failure at the Vancouver General Hospital, Canada. He won an Oscar in the Best Documentary Feature category for 'Just Another Missing Kid'. Zaritsky's work has been broadcast in 35 countries and screened at more than 40 film festivals around the world, including Sundance and Toronto.

215.title: Ranveer's performance in Jayeshbhai Jordaar 'tour de force': Producer
215.article_body: 'Jayeshbhai Jordaar' producer Maneesh Sharma said that actor Ranveer Singh has delivered a 'tour de force' performance in the film, adding that his acting makes him marvel yet again at the artistic heights Ranveer's capable of. "It's always a mix of pride and joy to collaborate with Ranveer. The early promise I sensed in Ranveer has been realised," added Maneesh.

216.title: Unfortunate that Sanju hasn't been able to seal his place in Team India: Akhtar
216.article_body: Former Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said it's unfortunate that RR captain Sanju Samson hasn't been able to seal his place in Team India. Akhtar added, "Sanju should play more matches for India, I think he's one of the finest players." Akhtar further said that England batter Jos Buttler's talent has also not been recognised yet.

217.title: Punjab CM Bhagwant Mann announces task force to deal with gangsters
217.article_body: Punjab Chief Minister Bhagwant Mann on Tuesday ordered the formation of an anti-gangster task force, led by an officer of the Additional Director General of Police rank, to deal with gangs in the state. The task force will be formed to combat organised crime and it will have an integrated collection of intelligence, manning and execution of operations, officials said.

218.title: Objective of Criminal Procedure Bill is to protect citizens' human rights: Amit Shah
218.article_body: Union Home Minister Amit Shah said that the Criminal Procedure (Identification) Bill has been brought with the objective to protect the human rights of crores of law-abiding citizens. "Its sole objective is to improve the conviction rate in the country…Send a strong message in society," Shah added. "It had not been brought for any misuse," Shah stated.

219.title: Jadeja has given headache to Dhoni to look after field setting and everything: Harbhajan
219.article_body: Former India off-spinner Harbhajan Singh has said that he feels that MS Dhoni is still the captain of CSK. "Jadeja has given headache to MS Dhoni to look after the field setting and everything [when he goes and fields outside the ring]," Harbhajan stated. "Jadeja needs to stand up and talk about a few things," Harbhajan added.

220.title: Former Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal diagnosed with prostate cancer
220.article_body: Ex-Manchester United manager Louis van Gaal said that he is receiving treatment for prostate cancer. The 70-year-old, who is currently in charge of the Netherlands national team, made the announcement on Dutch TV programme Humberto. Manchester United tweeted, "Everybody at Manchester United is fully behind our former manager...in his battle against cancer. Sending you strength and courage, Louis."

221.title: West staged mass killings in Ukraine's Bucha to discredit us: Russia
221.article_body: The mass killings of civilians in Ukraine's Bucha are part of a deceitful attempt by the West to "discredit Russia", Vyacheslav Volodin, Speaker of Russia's lower house of Parliament, said. "Washington and Brussels are the screenwriters, directors and Kyiv are the actors," Volodin added. Bucha Mayor Anatoliy Fedoruk on Saturday said that nearly 300 civilians were killed by Russian forces.

222.title: 1 lakh methamphetamine tablets worth ₹30 crore seized in Mizoram
222.article_body: Crime Investigation Department (CID) seized one lakh tablets of methamphetamine worth ₹30 crore in Mizoram's Aizawl, police said. The CID team raided the Zohnuai area in the Vaivakawn neighbourhood following a tip-off. The tablets were seized from the possession of a woman peddler, a resident of Farkawn village in Champhai district bordering Myanmar, police added.

223.title: Jason Momoa to star in historical drama 'Chief of War'
223.article_body: Jason Momoa is set to star in Apple's historical drama 'Chief of War'. The 'Aquaman' star is also attached to write and executive produce the limited series. The series follows the story of the unification and colonisation of Hawaii from an indigenous point of view, Variety reported. Jason will also be seen in 'Aquaman 2' and 'Fast & Furious 10'.

224.title: I wouldn't pick Warner in DC's playing XI against LSG: Hogg
224.article_body: Brad Hogg said he'll not include Australia opener David Warner in DC's playing XI against LSG on Thursday, even if he's available and will choose Tim Seifert instead. "I would want more right-handers to face Ravi Bishnoi as he's very dominant against left-handers with his wrong ones," he added. Warner joined DC camp late due to Australia's series in Pakistan.

225.title: B'luru woman who collapsed in gym died of cerebral haemorrhage: Autopsy
225.article_body: The post-mortem report of a 35-year-old woman who died after collapsing while working out at a Bengaluru-based gym has revealed the cause of death. According to the report, her death was caused by a cerebral haemorrhage, which was the result of a blood vessel rupture caused by stress in the brain. Footage of the woman collapsing was captured on CCTV.

226.title: Sanjay Raut's properties attached by ED in ₹1,000 cr land scam case
226.article_body: The Enforcement Directorate said on Tuesday that it has attached properties of senior Shiv Sena leader Sanjay Raut in connection to the ₹1,034 crore Patra Chawl land scam case. A plot owned by Raut in Alibaug and another flat of his in Mumbai's Dadar were attached. Raut, who is a close aide of Maharashtra CM Uddhav Thackeray, tweeted, "Asatyamev wins."

227.title: Govt blocks 22 India, Pak-based YouTube channels for spreading fake news
227.article_body: The government has issued orders to block 22 YouTube news channels, three Twitter accounts, one Facebook account, and one news website. "The...channels...were used to spread fake news, and coordinated disinformation...on subjects sensitive from the perspective of national security," the government said. The blocked YouTube channels include 18 India-based channels and four based in Pakistan.

228.title: Shut meat shops during Navratri, respect sentiments: East Delhi Mayor
228.article_body: East Delhi Mayor Shyam Sunder Aggarwal has urged meat shop owners to close their establishments during Navrati and respect Hindu sentiments. "We don't consume even onion-garlic during Navratri," he added. Further, he said there's a rule that meat shops will remain shut on Saptami, Ashtami and Navami. "If slaughterhouses will be closed, meat will not be sold," he said.

229.title: IIT grad who attacked police in Gorakhpur didn't meet family for 3 yrs: ATS
229.article_body: The IIT-Bombay graduate who attacked two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh's Gorakhpur on Sunday did not meet his family for the last three years, the UP ATS said. ATS officials visited Navi Mumbai where the accused, Ahmad Murtaza Abbasi, used to live with his family. UP Police said Abbasi forcibly tried to enter the Gorakhnath temple premises.

230.title: How much are petrol and diesel prices expected to further rise according to experts?
230.article_body: Experts have noted that retail prices of petrol and diesel need to be hiked by ₹0.52-0.60 for every $1/barrel rise in the price of crude oil for oil marketing companies. The price of Brent crude has risen by about $28.4/barrel since November 4 to $108.9/barrel, indicating that fuel prices could see further hikes of ₹5.5-7.8/litre each on petrol and diesel.

231.title: Gets stressful but I'm my fans' baby: Rashmika on living up to expectations
231.article_body: Actress Rashmika Mandanna said that she would be lying if she said that it doesn't get stressful to live up to the expectations of fans. "But I am my fans' baby...I like it when I do something they like...Making them happy is what keeps me going...which keeps me motivated to work harder and keep getting...better at what...I do," she added.

232.title: 9 criminals nabbed in 2 separate shootouts with Noida Police
232.article_body: Noida Police on Monday said that they have arrested nine suspected criminals in two separate shootouts, leaving five of them injured. The accused were involved in theft and kidnappings, according to the police. The police also said that they have recovered four pistols, five knifes, two cars and one bike from their possession.

233.title: H'yana to stay in Chandigarh until money given for new capital: Vij
233.article_body: Haryana Home Minister Anil Vij has said that the state will "stand firm" in Chandigarh until it gets "one single decision over Sutlej Yamuna Link canal water, Hindi-speaking regions and money from the Centre for establishing a new capital." Earlier, Punjab passed a resolution to transfer Chandigarh to itself. "[Haryana won't] pull back...'Angad ka paer' from Chandigarh," he added.

234.title: 3 killed, 6 injured after bus comes in contact with live wire in Jaisalmer
234.article_body: Three people were killed while six others were injured after a bus came in contact with a live wire in Rajasthan's Jaisalmer on Tuesday. According to ASI Mukesh Beera, the incident occurred on Jaisalmer-Chelak road when the bus was returning from a fair in Guhda village. One person who was critically injured was referred to a Jodhpur hospital, police added.

235.title: J&K students who cheered for Pak still in jail for lack of bail money
235.article_body: Three Kashmiri students, facing sedition charge for celebrating Pakistan's victory over India in the T20 World Cup, are stuck in Agra Central Jail despite getting bail owing to lack of money to pay for the surety deposit. "Their release from jail still seems a distant dream because the court has asked us to deposit ₹6 lakh," said a student's uncle.

236.title: Ranbir Kapoor, Alia Bhatt to get married on April 17 at RK Studios: Report
236.article_body: Actors Ranbir Kapoor and Alia Bhatt will get married on April 17, as per a report by ETimes. "Alia's grandfather N Razdan wanted to see her getting married to Ranbir...The ceremony will be held at RK Studios and nothing extravagant has been planned yet," the report said while quoting a source. It will reportedly be a close-knit family affair.

237.title: Pic of female sniper called 'Charcoal' surfaces amid war in Ukraine
237.article_body: A picture of Ukrainian female sniper known as 'Charcoal' is being widely shared online, with people calling her a "national hero" amid war with Russia. "We must take them all out. These people are not human beings. Even the fascists were not as vile as these orcs. We must defeat them," she said in a speech.

238.title: Torture chamber used by Russians found in Bucha, 5 corpses found inside: Officials
238.article_body: Authorities in Ukraine said they've discovered a torture chamber in the basement of a children's sanatorium in Bucha. Bodies of five men with their hands tied were also found in the chamber used by Russian troops, they said, adding that their deaths are being investigated as a war crime. Mass graves have also reportedly been found in Bucha.

239.title: Tired of waiting, keeping options open: Son of Cong's Ahmed Patel
239.article_body: Late Congress leader Ahmed Patel's son Faisal Patel, in an apparent reference to the party leadership, on Tuesday said he was tired of waiting around. "No encouragement from...top brass. Keeping my options open," he tweeted. He had earlier said that he will enter electoral politics if Congress asks. Ahmed Patel was a close aide of Congress chief Sonia Gandhi.

240.title: RR's bowling against Plessis, Kohli is going to be a big test for them: Hogg
240.article_body: Ex-Australia spinner Brad Hogg has said RR lack pace in their attack and their bowling against RCB's Faf du Plessis and Virat Kohli is going to be a big test for them. "RR are going to be put under extreme pressure...Their bowling is probably their weak link," he added. RR will play against RCB on Tuesday night.

241.title: US seizes $34 million worth of crypto tied to illegal dark web acts
241.article_body: The US government has seized $34 million worth of cryptocurrency tied to illegal dark web activity. The cryptocurrency was seized from a US resident who used an online alias to sell over 100,000 illicit items across marketplaces on the dark web. The majority of the sales are said to be hacked account information from major services including HBO and Netflix.

242.title: Single most annoying problem on Twitter: Elon Musk on crypto scam bots
242.article_body: World's richest person Elon Musk, whose 9.2% passive stake in Twitter was disclosed on Monday, said crypto scam bots are the "single most annoying problem on Twitter". He was replying to a Twitter user who suggested that "improving the verification system to prove that you're an actual real human" would help with the problem. Musk is now Twitter's largest shareholder.

243.title: SC to hear electoral bonds case, says would've heard earlier if not for COVID
243.article_body: Supreme Court has agreed to urgently hear pleas challenging the laws on the issuance of electoral bonds. "Had it not been for COVID-19, the court would have heard the case earlier," CJI NV Ramana said. Advocate Prashant Bhushan cited a report before the SC stating that a Calcutta-based company paid ₹40 crore through electoral bonds to bypass excise related issues.

244.title: Peers gave idiotic advice, parents told me not to listen to bulls**t: Vivaan
244.article_body: Actor Vivaan Shah said he made the mistake of chasing stardom and success early in his career and he wishes he would have had listened to his parents. "My peers...and my friends were filling my head...with all kinds of idiotic advice...I must be like this to be a star or leading man...My parents told me...not to listen to...bullsh**t," he added.

245.title: I have miserably failed with regular love stories: John Abraham
245.article_body: John Abraham said he has miserably failed when he has done a regular love story, adding that he has not acted in a love story that is different for a long time. Discussing his untitled upcoming film with director Abhishek Sharma, John stated, "You'll scratch your head and think, 'What were you thinking when you decided to do this?'"

246.title: No alliance with TRS in Telangana: Rahul tells state Cong leaders
246.article_body: Senior Congress leader Rahul Gandhi has told the Telangana Congress leaders in a meeting at his Delhi residence that there will be "no alliance" with TRS for the next year's state elections. "We held a discussion with Rahul ji over various issues...He will visit Telangana this month. No alliance...Congress will fight against TRS and BJP," said PCC chief Revanth Reddy.

247.title: PMC, police assure support for grand Ambedkar Jayanti celebrations
247.article_body: The Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) and police have assured support for grand celebrations to commemorate Ambedkar Jayanti on April 14. "I can assure cleanliness, provision of drinking water, washrooms and pandal at the statue of Babasaheb Ambedkar near the collector's office," PMC Commissioner Vikram Kumar said. Drone cameras may be deployed at locations for safety purposes, he added.

248.title: Salman felt that Sajid didn't have enough faith in his stardom: Report
248.article_body: Salman Khan's production house 'Salman Khan Films' will reportedly produce his upcoming film 'Kabhi Eid Kabhi Diwali', with producer Sajid Nadiadwala backing out of the film. "Salman felt that Sajid had developed cold feet and was not putting enough faith in the project and his stardom, whereas Sajid felt that Salman was taking things too lightly," the report added.

249.title: Films where dance is a natural element usually turn out very bad: Shahid
249.article_body: Shahid Kapoor said there have been many times in the past where songs have been added in his films just because he dances well, even if the song doesn't suit the movie. "Genuinely, I have been searching for a film where I can dance, and where dancing feels like a natural element...But the films...[of] that genre...[are] usually...so bad," added Shahid.

250.title: UK to launch its own NFT this summer, may use it to issue debt
250.article_body: UK's Chancellor of the Exchequer Rishi Sunak has directed the Royal Mint to introduce the country's own NFT by the summer, Economic Secretary to the Treasury John Glen said. He added that the NFT would be a symbol of the "forward-looking approach [the UK is] determined to take". The government may even consider issuing debt using the NFT, Glen said.

251.title: Sri Lanka's condition worrisome, India's could be worse: Sanjay Raut
251.article_body: Reacting to Sri Lanka's economic crisis, Shiv Sena's Sanjay Raut said that the country's situation is "worrisome". He further added that "India is on that path" and warned that if situation is not handled then India's condition will be worse than Sri Lanka. "Mamata Banerjee has also said to call for an all-party meeting under PM Modi's leadership," Raut added.

252.title: GB Nagar Police starts 'anti-Romeo' drive to ensure safety of women
252.article_body: Gautam Buddha Nagar Police has launched an 'anti-Romeo' drive in the district to ensure the safety of women, officials said. Women police personnel will carry out patrolling at crowded places, including metro stations, schools and colleges, ACP Ankita Sharma said. Police has also issued a helpline number where locals can raise a request for such a drive in their neighbourhood.

253.title: Twitter account of ex-IPS officer's wife hacked, complaint filed in Mumbai
253.article_body: Lawyer Abha Singh, wife of former IPS officer YP Singh, filed a complaint with Worli Police, alleging that her Twitter account was hacked on Sunday and the hacker demanded $500 to give her complete access to it. The accused reportedly put a Muslim man's picture as the profile picture. "I...changed the passwords of my other social media accounts," Singh said.

254.title: We must have a common culture post-merger: HDFC Chairman
254.article_body: HDFC and HDFC Bank "will have to have a common culture" after the merger, HDFC Chairman Deepak Parekh said on Tuesday. "Now, bank will have to deal in housing loans which is very emotional, personal...So we have to be very careful with all our customers," he added. As per the announcement, HDFC will acquire a 41% stake in HDFC Bank.

255.title: Bangladesh to lodge official complaint about sledging, umpiring after Test defeat to SA
255.article_body: The Bangladesh Cricket Board (BCB) will file a complaint with the ICC about sledging and umpiring during the Durban Test, which Bangladesh lost by 220 runs against South Africa. As per Bangladeshi players, umpires ignored their on-field complaints. The board said that the umpires also extended the lunch session to make up for half an hour instead of starting early.

256.title: Zomato shares decline after CCI orders probe
256.article_body: Shares of Zomato fell up to 5% on Tuesday after the Competition Commission of India (CCI) ordered an investigation into the conduct of Zomato and Swiggy. Zomato said it will assist the CCI in their investigation into the preferential listing of restaurant partners and pricing parity across platforms. Zomato shares later pared losses and were trading 2.61% lower on NSE.

257.title: Zebra foal born in Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park
257.article_body: A zebra foal was born in Bengaluru Bannerghatta Biological Park on Monday. With this, the total count of zebras in the park has increased to five. "All necessary arrangements, including a partition within the enclosure to provide privacy and safety, have been made," said Deputy Director of the biological park. According to an official, the foal is suckling and active.

258.title: Mt Everest like you've never seen it before: NASA on pic of Earth's highest mountain
258.article_body: NASA shared a picture of Mt Everest and wrote, "Mt Everest like you've never seen it before." "The highest mountain on Earth takes on a different perspective from...vantage point of space. An astronaut aboard the International Space Station...took this near-nadir (almost straight down) photograph of Mount Everest, which towers approximately 29,029 feet (8,848 metres) above sea-level," wrote NASA.

259.title: Boss in UK pays 60 employees over ₹74,000 each to help them pay bills
259.article_body: A boss in the UK paid 60 of his workers £750 (over ₹74,000) each to help them pay their bills amid rising living costs in the country. The 51-year-old MD of Emerys Timber and Builders Merchants said he wanted to "share back the success of the business". UK energy regulator Ofgem has announced a hike in the energy price cap.

260.title: Man flies down to B'luru from Gujarat to snatch chains, arrested
260.article_body: A 26-year-old man, who allegedly came to Bengaluru by flight to commit chain-snatching to keep his wife happy, was detained by CK Achukattu Police. The accused, identified as Umesh Khatik, was arrested after police gathered information on a snatching case in which the bike-borne miscreant had snatched two gold chains from a woman on December 26 last year.

261.title: Ukraine Mayor, her family members found dead with hands tied: Police
261.article_body: Ukrainian authorities have found the bodies of the mayor of Motyzhyn village, her husband, and their son. Police said the dead had their hands tied behind their backs. The bodies were reportedly found half-buried in a grave in a pine forest near her house. Olga Sukhenko and her family were allegedly abducted by invading Russian forces on March 24.

262.title: Bill Gates shares old video of himself jumping over chair as Microsoft turns 47
262.article_body: Microsoft Co-founder and the world's fourth-richest person, Bill Gates, took to Instagram to share an old video of himself jumping over a chair to celebrate 47 years of Microsoft's existence. "It took leaps and bounds to accomplish Microsoft's vision of a computer on every desk and in every home," wrote Gates. Microsoft was founded on April 4, 1975.

263.title: Sounds reasonable: Elon Musk on 'two conditions' for edit button on Twitter
263.article_body: The world's richest person and Twitter's biggest shareholder, Elon Musk, responded "that sounds reasonable" to a tweet suggesting "two conditions" under which an edit button should be introduced on Twitter. The tweet suggested that the edit button should be available only for a few minutes and that the edit history should be visible. Musk owns a 9.2% stake in Twitter.

264.title: Pic shows dog refusing to abandon Ukrainian owner killed by Russian troops
264.article_body: A picture has been widely shared online showing a dog refusing to abandon its Ukrainian owner killed by Russian troops. Reacting to the picture of the dog sitting next to the body of its owner, a Twitter user wrote, "Such a heart-rending picture, I hope someone can take this poor dog in and feed and love him."

265.title: SpaceX, NASA delay launch of 1st private astronaut mission to ISS
265.article_body: SpaceX, NASA have delayed the launch of the 1st all-private mission to the International Space Station, Axiom Space's Ax-1 astronaut mission, to April 8. The mission will fly four civilians, including former NASA astronaut Michael López-Alegría, for a 10-day mission to the space station. The crew will ride atop a Falcon 9 rocket by Elon Musk's SpaceX.

266.title: Saffron-coloured caps, energy bars with PM's pic distributed to 400 BJP MPs
266.article_body: During the parliamentary meeting of the Bharatiya Janata Party, 400 BJP MPs were given saffron coloured caps and energy bars with Prime Minister Narendra Modi's picture on the wrapper. The caps were reportedly prepared in Surat after the party leadership approved the final design. The caps have the name and symbol of the party on them.

267.title: Ukrainian woman writes family details on daughter's back in case she's killed; pic surfaces
267.article_body: Ukrainian mothers are writing family details on their children's bodies in case their parents are killed by Russians. Ukraine President Volodymyr Zelenskyy's former spokesperson tweeted a photo, saying, "A Ukrainian mom wrote on her daughter's body the name, date of birth, numbers of parents so if she is lost or they are killed during war someone can help the girl."

268.title: It's not only for azaan: K'taka CM on demand for loudspeaker ban in mosques
268.article_body: Commenting on the demand by some organisations to ban loudspeakers in mosques, Karnataka CM Basavaraj Bommai said, "It is not only for azaan, it is for all loudspeakers." He added that it is a high court order and it is not forced. "Everything has to be done by talking and explaining to people...So, we will take a call," Bommai stated.

269.title: DJ Khaled to be honoured with a star on Hollywood Walk of Fame
269.article_body: DJ Khaled will be honoured with a star on the Hollywood Walk of Fame. The 46-year-old American DJ will be the 2,719th celebrity to receive a star on the walkway. "DJ Khaled is one of the most popular and ever-present impresarios of the rap industry and we're thrilled to honour him!" said Ana Martinez, Hollywood Walk of Fame Producer.

270.title: My parents were separated; didn't tell anyone I'm Pankaj Kapur's son: Shahid
270.article_body: Shahid Kapoor revealed that he initially feared that he wouldn't make it as an actor. "My parents were separated, and I didn't use to live in Bombay, I came here...late," he said. "My mother was a single mom, and I was a little older while Ishaan (Khatter) was very young. I never told anyone...[about being Pankaj Kapur's son]," he added.

271.title: MNS Muslim leader resigns, accuses party of turning 'communal'
271.article_body: A Muslim politician, Majid Shaikh, has tendered his resignation from the Raj Thackeray-led Maharashtra Navnirman Sena (MNS) by accusing it of being "more focused on communalism". "Raj saheb was an icon for me...that's why I had joined...in 2009. But now...politics of communalism has crept in MNS," Shaikh said. Notably, the Pune-based politician was an MNS branch head.

272.title: Haryana CM moves resolution on Chandigarh issue, Sutlej-Yamuna canal
272.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Tuesday moved a resolution in the state Assembly noting with concern the Punjab Assembly's recent move on the transfer of the joint capital of Chandigarh. Khattar's resolution also urged the central government to take steps to construct the Sutlej Yamuna Link (SYL) Canal. He accused Punjab of enacting legislations to deny Haryana's rightful claims.

273.title: Tharoor shares 2018 tweet on edit button, says 'Even our bureaucracy is quicker'
273.article_body: Amid speculations of an edit button on Twitter, Congress MP Shashi Tharoor remarked, "Even responses from our bureaucracy tend to be quicker." Sharing his 2018 tweet, where he called for an edit button, Tharoor wrote, "If it's real, thanks for listening in 2018 and acting in 2022!" Twitter on April 1 had said it was working on an edit button.

274.title: Russian troops need significant re-equipping & refurbishment: UK
274.article_body: The British Defence Ministry said that Ukrainian forces have retaken key terrain in the north after forcing Russia to retreat from the areas around Chernihiv and north of the capital, Kyiv. "Many Russian units withdrawing from northern Ukraine are likely to require significant re-equipping and refurbishment before being available to redeploy for operations in eastern Ukraine," it added.

275.title: Our belief within ourselves is what I believe is going to help us win: Plessis
275.article_body: Ahead of their match against RR on Tuesday night, RCB captain Faf du Plessis addressed the team and said that their belief in themselves is the most important thing that'll help them win this tournament. "Everyone should play their part to get us across the line...we don't rely on one big superstar to win us the trophy," he added.

276.title: 3 rob driver of his taxi in Punjab, give him ₹150 bus fare to reach home
276.article_body: Three miscreants, posing as passengers, robbed a driver of his taxi in Punjab's Khanna. The accused had booked a taxi to Khanna, who upon reaching the destination, took out their gun and asked the driver to get off. They also gave him ₹150 bus fare to reach Moga, where he belonged while fleeing, the cab driver told police.

277.title: Maximum temperature in Delhi to touch 39 degrees Celsius today: IMD
277.article_body: The India Meteorological Department (IMD) on Tuesday said that the maximum temperature in Delhi is expected to touch 39 degrees Celsius, while the air quality index (AQI) may stay in 'poor' category. The minimum temperature is likely to stay at 19 degrees Celsius, as per IMD's forecast. On Monday, the maximum temperature was recorded at 38.1 degrees Celsius in Delhi.

278.title: Stepped as a student, not co-star: Charan on working with dad Chiranjeevi
278.article_body: Speaking about his experience of working with his father, actor Chiranjeevi in 'Acharya', actor Ram Charan said, "It's a dream come true...I don't think I stepped into 'Acharya' as a co-star, I've stepped...as...student and I've learned a lot from him." "He never handheld me through any of the shooting days...He let me make mistakes...But...never lost his cool," Charan added.

279.title: Facial recognition system to be launched at Pune airport in 2023
279.article_body: A facial recognition system will be launched at Pune's Lohegaon Airport by March 2023, Minister of State for Civil Aviation VK Singh said in Parliament. The system will be launched as part of the Centre's Digi Yatra initiative to provide passengers "seamless and hassle-free experience at airports". The system's preliminary testing has been completed, he added.

280.title: NCPCR objects to textbook chapter by Harsh Mander, writes to NCERT
280.article_body: The National Commission for Protection of Child Rights (NCPCR) has objected to the inclusion of a chapter titled 'Weathering the Storm in Ersama' authored by social activist Harsh Mander in Class IX English textbook. In a letter seeking reply from NCERT, the rights body said the story suggests that rescue and welfare work are done only by NGOs.

281.title: Was told should do ₹150-cr film, people will put money after Kabir Singh: Shahid
281.article_body: Actor Shahid Kapoor said that after the film 'Kabir Singh', everyone said that he should do a ₹150-crore film and that people will back him up with money. "I thought, sure they will put money, but what will the film be? There's a difference between making a scaled film and a good film," Shahid added.

282.title: I admire Aishwarya's dignity in tough times; lucky to have her: Abhishek
282.article_body: Actor Abhishek Bachchan praised his wife, actress Aishwarya Rai Bachchan and said that he and his family are lucky to have her in their lives. "She's always been an amazing emotional support for me," he added. "[Aishwarya] has...managed to traverse some of the most difficult times of her life with utmost dignity and grace. I...admire that about her," Abhishek said.

283.title: Determined to do whatever needed to ensure Cong's unity: Sonia Gandhi
283.article_body: Congress President Sonia Gandhi said the road ahead for the party is "more challenging than ever before", which will put to test the party’s dedication, determination and spirit of resilience. "Unity at all levels of our vast organisation is of paramount importance and speaking for myself, I am determined to do whatever is needed to ensure it," Sonia Gandhi added.

284.title: Amy recalls joke on Alec's shooting incident that wasn't allowed at Oscars
284.article_body: American stand-up comedian Amy Schumer said that she wasn't allowed to make a joke about last year's shooting incident involving actor Alec Baldwin. "Don't Look Up is the name of movie? More like don't look down the barrel of Alec Baldwin's shotgun...I wasn't allowed to say any of that, but you can just come up and [slap] someone," Amy added.

285.title: It's strange but there will be some banter: Harshal on facing Chahal
285.article_body: Talking about playing against his ex-RCB teammate Yuzvendra Chahal when RCB take on RR, all-rounder Harshal Patel admitted that it will be a little strange but added that there will be some banter. Harshal recently became the second player to bowl two maiden overs in an IPL match, after recording the feat against KKR.

286.title: Abandoned at vacant plot, 1-day-old girl dies in Ludhiana
286.article_body: The body of an abandoned newborn girl was found on a plot in Ludhiana on Sunday. The girl, who had her umbilical cord still attached, appeared to be a day old, police said. Locals were reportedly alerted by her cries, but when they reached the spot, she had already succumbed. Police are scanning the area's CCTVs to trace the accused.

287.title: PMC to begin online licence renewal process for Pune hospitals
287.article_body: Pune Municipal Corporation (PMC) has decided to start an online registration process for all city hospitals wherein they will be able to renew their licence every three years through the online process. "Earlier, it used to take about 21 days for the documentation process...online system will reduce the time taken for the documentation to under a week," an official said.

288.title: Sri Lanka's new Finance Minister resigns just after one day amid financial crisis
288.article_body: Sri Lanka's new Finance Minister Ali Sabry resigned on Tuesday, a day after President Gotabaya Rajapaksa appointed him after sacking his brother Basil Rajapaksa amid financial crisis. In his resignation letter, Sabry wrote he had accepted the role "only as an interim measure". He added, "Whilst I regret the inconvenience caused...I've always acted in the best interests of the country."

289.title: Sri Lanka's ruling coalition loses majority in Parliament amid economic crisis
289.article_body: Amid the economic crisis in the country, Sri Lankan President Gotabaya Rajapaksa's ruling coalition lost its majority in Parliament as proceedings began on Tuesday. At least 41 lawmakers walked out of the alliance. Earlier, Rajapaksa said he won't resign, adding that he is ready to hand over the government to whoever proves majority in Parliament.

290.title: BJP has become a 'company' recovering increased costs from public: Akhilesh
290.article_body: Samajwadi Party chief Akhilesh Yadav on Tuesday, while commenting on increased fuel prices in the country, alleged that BJP has become a "company", which is passing on "increased cost" to people without reducing profit. "Government's role in a democracy is...to make policies, which are in the public interest, so that no one can exploit and oppress the people," he tweeted.

291.title: Priyanka Chopra shares pic of 'Made in India' manhole cover in Los Angeles
291.article_body: Priyanka Chopra shared a picture on Instagram of herself and her niece Krishna alongside a 'Made in India' manhole cover they spotted in Los Angeles. 'Made in India' manhole covers began to crop up in US in late 1980s and 1990s, a report in The Juggernaut said. These covers are exported to US after being made in foundries in India.

292.title: Richa Chadha posts pics, says 'Healthy weight loss means you don't lose muscle'
292.article_body: Actress Richa Chadha posted pictures on Instagram along with the caption, "Healthy weight loss means you don't lose muscle, like in my case the gluteus maximus is intact." Chadha, who lost 15 kg in 3 months, took to Instagram in February this year and shared a video about embracing our "ever-changing bodies".

293.title: Delhi Police arrests MBA student who posed as woman on Insta to cheat people
293.article_body: A 25-year-old MBA student has been arrested by Delhi Police for allegedly cheating people using a fake Instagram account on which he posed as a woman and sold fake cryptocurrency and investment schemes. E-vouchers worth ₹15 lakh were found with the accused. He was arrested from Haryana after a woman alleged she was cheated of over ₹1.7 lakh by him.

294.title: The day when Manish Pandey will be dropped is not far: Aakash Chopra
294.article_body: Cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra has said LSG batter Manish Pandey, who has scored 22 runs in three games this season, might be dropped from the playing XI unless he starts contributing with the bat. "Someone will have to go once Marcus Stoinis comes. I feel Manish Pandey's days are really numbered if he continues batting like this," stated Aakash.

295.title: Class 10 girl in Ludhiana dies by suicide fearing poor grades
295.article_body: A 16-year-old girl allegedly died by suicide a day after appearing for her Class 10 pre-board examination in Ludhiana. The girl, who aspired to become a doctor, felt she performed poorly in the exam, her family told the police. Reportedly, she was also upset over scoring less in a school test as her exams were due.

296.title: Terror attacks aimed at crippling Kashmir's economy: JKPC chief
296.article_body: Jammu and Kashmir People's Conference chief Sajad Lone on Tuesday said that the recent terror attacks were aimed at crippling the economy. "The violence in Kashmir is not only senseless and barbaric but also aimed at economically crippling the Kashmiri economy," said Lone. "The butchers seem to be hell-bent on destroying [the economy]," he added.

297.title: India's maritime sector scaled new heights in last 8 years: PM Modi
297.article_body: On the occasion of National Maritime Day, PM Narendra Modi on Tuesday said that in the last eight years, India’s maritime sector has scaled new heights and contributed to boosting trade and commercial activities. "Today, on National Maritime Day we recall our glorious maritime history and highlight the importance of the maritime sector towards India’s economic growth," PM Modi tweeted.

298.title: World has found resonance, volcano has erupted: Ashoke on 'The Kashmir...'
298.article_body: Filmmaker and social activist Ashoke Pandit, while talking about 'The Kashmir Files', said that not only India but the world has found resonance in the thought process of the film. "[The world] wants to know why no one spoke about this issue earlier. A volcano has erupted and there is no stopping now," he added.

299.title: CSK can't lose 3 in a row even if Deepak Chahar's missing: Irfan Pathan
299.article_body: Reacting to CSK recording their worst start in an IPL season after losing their first three IPL 2022 matches, Irfan Pathan tweeted that CSK need to step up. He added that CSK can't lose three consecutive matches despite missing Deepak Chahar. CSK lost by 54 runs in their IPL 2022 match against PBKS. Chahar is recovering from a hamstring injury.

300.title: Why not ban liquor in Ramzan?: Cong leader on banning meat sale during Navratri
300.article_body: Reacting to reports of meat shops asked to shut in some parts of the country for Navratri, Congress leader Salman Nizami said, "Why not ban liquor during Holy Ramadan?" Taking to Twitter, the politician said, "If you don't eat onion or meat in Navratri why stop others. Is this democracy? What about our sentiments and constitutional rights!"

301.title: He would travel 80 km for practice: MI all-rounder Tilak Varma's coach Bayash
301.article_body: MI all-rounder Tilak Varma's coach Salam Bayash said Tilak would travel 80 km for practice, adding that the cricketer's family members were very supportive despite facing hardships. Tilak scored 61 runs off 33 balls at a strike rate of 184.84 in MI's IPL 2022 match against RR, with the knock comprising three boundaries and five sixes.

302.title: SRH had upper hand till Avesh's over, he has improved in last 12 months: Shastri
302.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has praised LSG pacer Avesh Khan for his performance against SRH, stating that the 25-year-old has improved in the last 12 months. "SRH had the upper hand [till Avesh's over]...He's improving. I've seen him come up through the ranks...Last year's IPL gave him a lot of confidence," stated Shastri. Avesh picked four wickets against SRH.

303.title: Alia Bhatt-backed D2C wellness startup Phool raises $8 million
303.article_body: Alia Bhatt-backed fragrance-focussed wellness startup ﻿Phool.co has raised $8 million in Series A funding led by Sixth Sense Ventures. The round also saw participation from existing investors, actress Alia Bhatt and IAN fund. Founded by Ankit Agarwal, Phool.co focuses on converting floral waste into charcoal free luxury incense products. Alia had invested in the startup in October.

304.title: 3 tigers die in 3 days in Madhya Pradesh forests over territorial fights
304.article_body: Three tigers were found dead in two forests of Madhya Pradesh in the past three days, forest officials said, adding that the cause of deaths was territorial fights. One of the dead tigers was aged five months. "The carcass has grievous injury marks. The spinal cord was found broken, as though she was attacked by another tiger," an official said.

305.title: SP MLA Shazil Ansari booked for objectionable remarks against UP CM
305.article_body: Samajwadi Party (SP) MLA, Shazil Islam Ansari from Bhojipura, and others were booked for making objectionable remarks against UP CM Yogi Adityanath in Bareilly, police said. Ansari had also allegedly said, "If the voice of the opposition is suppressed...then a reply will be given through guns." FIR was lodged following a complaint by Bareilly's Hindu Yuva Vahini district president.

306.title: Squid Game maker to helm Killing Old People Club, says 'It'll be more violent'
306.article_body: Hwang Dong-hyuk, director of South Korean survival drama series 'Squid Game', has announced that he's developing 'Killing Old People Club', a film inspired by a novel penned by Italian historian-novelist Umberto Eco. He said it will be more violent than 'Squid Game', adding that he might have to hide from old people after the film comes out.

307.title: Group with AK-47s shoots at Bihar MLC candidate's convoy; 1 dead
307.article_body: An Independent candidate for Bihar MLC elections had a narrow escape after a group of assailants armed with AK-47s allegedly shot at his convoy in Siwan on Monday. A 30-year-old villager who was in a car behind the convoy was killed in the attack after multiple bullets hit him. Four people, including two of the poll candidate's supporters, were injured.

308.title: We need to overhaul our legal structure in a big way: IT Minister
308.article_body: India needs a legal structure that balances the right to freedom of expression and regulation of cyberspace, IT Minister Ashwini Vaishnaw said. "We need to overhaul our legal structure in a big way. I don’t think any incremental changes will help," he added. "The change has to be substantial, structural and fundamental and that's where the conflict starts," Vaishnaw stated.

309.title: Peru imposes curfew to curb protests over rising fuel costs
309.article_body: Peruvian President Pedro Castillo on Tuesday imposed a curfew in the capital Lima, banning people from leaving their homes to curb protests against rising fuel and fertiliser prices, triggered by Russia's invasion of Ukraine. The Peruvian government said the protests that have spread throughout the country have become increasingly violent and at least four people have been killed so far.

310.title: It's my passion project, we shot it in one go: Abhishek on 'Oththa...' remake
310.article_body: Abhishek Bachchan in an interview spoke about his upcoming project, tentatively titled 'SSS7', which is the Hindi remake of Tamil thriller film 'Oththa Seruppu Size 7'. The actor, who's also producing the film, said, "It's my passion project. We shot it in one go." "I'm the only actor in...film. Although there are other characters, you never see them," Abhishek added.

311.title: Dad never raised his hand on me but mom tried to smack me a few times: Abhishek
311.article_body: When asked if his parents, actor Amitabh Bachchan and Jaya Bachchan ever reprimanded him when he was a student, Abhishek Bachchan replied, "They never scolded me...they'd calmly explain to me that they were working very hard to pay for my education...My father...never raised his hand on me." He said that his mother had "tried" to smack him a few times.

312.title: Planet 9 times bigger than Jupiter found forming unconventionally
312.article_body: NASA's Hubble telescope has spotted a gigantic Jupiter-like planet forming in an "unconventional way". The discovery supports a long-debated theory for how planets like Jupiter form, called "disk instability", NASA said. Sharing the images taken by Hubble, NASA said the planet, called AB Aurigae b, is probably about nine times bigger than Jupiter.

313.title: US rapper's dead body seen standing upright as funeral held at nightclub
313.article_body: The dead body of rapper Goonew, who was shot dead during a robbery on March 18, was seen standing upright at a nightclub in US. The funeral of the 24-year-old rapper, whose real name was Markelle Antonio Morrow, was held at the nightclub, with video showing people dancing. An entry pass for the event called it a "celebration of life".

314.title: 3 dot balls should be 1 wicket: Chahal on Chopra's '8 runs for 100-plus metre six' remark
314.article_body: While reacting to PBKS all-rounder Liam Livingstone's 108-metre six against CSK, cricketer-turned-commentator Aakash Chopra suggested that eight runs should be given for 100-plus metre six. Reacting to Chopra's tweet, RR leg-spinner Yuzvendra Chahal tweeted, "Three dot balls should be one wicket bhaiya." Commenting on Chahal's tweet, Suresh Raina wrote, "Hahah."

315.title: It was my duty: Rajasthan policeman who saved infant from burning house tells CM
315.article_body: Netresh Sharma, a 31-year-old constable whose photo of saving an infant from a burning house amidst violence in Rajasthan's Karauli went viral, told CM Ashok Gehlot that he was performing his duty on a phone call with him. Gehlot promoted Sharma to the post of Head Constable and congratulated him. Sharma saved four lives during communal violence in the city.

316.title: Woman rubs chilli powder in son's eyes in Telangana for marijuana addiction, video viral
316.article_body: A video has gone viral on social media showing a woman rubbing chilli powder in her son's eyes after tying him to pole as a punishment for marijuana addiction. The video is from Kodad town in Suryapet district of Telangana. In the video, the 15-year-old boy was heard screaming after he was tied to the pole.

317.title: Man booked for molesting brother's wife in Ludhiana
317.article_body: Ludhiana Police booked a man for allegedly molesting his 26-year-old sister-in-law on Sunday. The complainant alleged her husband's brother molested her after a spat on March 8. He had also attempted to establish a physical relationship with her on multiple occasions, she claimed. The woman also alleged that she informed her husband about the incident, but to no avail.

318.title: Our media should boycott them: Kangana on Lata's name missing at Grammys, Oscars
318.article_body: Kangana Ranaut expressed her disappointment after Grammy Awards and Academy Awards omitted Lata Mangeshkar in the 'In Memoriam' section during their ceremonies. "We must take strong stands against any local awards who claim to be international and yet ignore...legendary artists because of their race or ideologies," she wrote on Instagram. She added "our media should...boycott these biased events".

319.title: Delhi court acquits man in death of minor 'electrocuted by water cooler'
319.article_body: A Delhi court has acquitted a man who was accused in the death case of his neighbour's five-year-old son. The minor was allegedly electrocuted by a water cooler owned by the man in May 2004 in southwest Delhi. The victim's father had claimed that the cooler had a leakage and despite several warnings, the accused did not fix it.

320.title: Fraudster cheats senior citizen of ₹85,000 in Mumbai, police recover money
320.article_body: The cyber unit of the Mira Bhayandar-Vasai Virar (MBVV) police recovered ₹85,000 that a Mumbai-based senior citizen had lost in a cyber-fraud. The fraudster, impersonated as an SBI executive, stole her banking details and shopped on Flipkart. The cyber unit checked the transactions and got in touch with Flipkart's nodal officer and made them reverse the transactions, saving her money.

321.title: You set me on the path of environmental consciousness: Grammy winner to PM Modi
321.article_body: After Prime Minister Narendra Modi congratulated Ricky Kej for winning the second Grammy Award, the Indian music composer tweeted, "Wow.. speechless! To receive praise from the Hon'ble Prime Minister himself!" "I hope I made you proud. You set me on the path of environmental consciousness 7 years ago when I won my 1st Grammy award," he said.

322.title: 45-yr-old truck driver from B'luru arrested for running over stray dog in Mumbai
322.article_body: A 45-year-old truck driver from Bengaluru has been arrested and his vehicle has been seized for allegedly running over a stray dog in Mumbai's Andheri (West), police said. The incident was witnessed by a local resident, who alerted police. The accused was produced before a magistrate court and was granted bail on the surety of ₹40,000, police added.

323.title: 10 held in last two days for fleeing with poultry trucks in Pune
323.article_body: The Pune rural police have arrested 10 people so far in the last two days in connection with two separate incidents of armed robbers capturing trucks carrying chickens. In the first case, the suspects ran chicken shops prior to the pandemic but had run into losses while in the second one, the suspects desired to earn easy money, police said.

324.title: 2 house helps booked as Mumbai woman complains of theft, sexual harassment
324.article_body: Police have registered an FIR and have booked two house helps after a 45-year-old woman in Mumbai complained of theft and sexual harassment. The victim said one of the accused allegedly stole ₹19,000 from her house last month, following which he stopped coming to work. As per the FIR, the other accused had allegedly sent her obscene video and messages.

325.title: Shared carnatic music with friends, they'd say 'it's weird': Musician Aditya
325.article_body: Carnatic Musician Aditya Prakash said that he and his "desi friends" felt like outsiders and wanted to fit in an "American social setting". "I was embarrassed to share Carnatic music with my friends. The few times I did, they would say 'this is weird, what is this'. There was a wall built between my identities," he added.

326.title: Congress does not look outside the Gandhi family: Anurag Thakur
326.article_body: Union Minister Anurag Thakur criticised the Congress and said that the party does not look outside the Gandhi family. "Rahul Gandhi took charge but didn't get any seats in West Bengal. Priyanka Gandhi took charge of UP but lost deposits and won only two seats. Now again Sonia Gandhi has taken command of the party," he added.

327.title: 3 teenage boys on picnic drown in river in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni
327.article_body: Three 16-year-old boys in Madhya Pradesh's Seoni district drowned while bathing in a river on Monday. According to police, the incident occurred at 4 pm at the Hirri river near Jenwara village when the boys had gone for a picnic with another friend. They entered the water when their friend had gone to bring breakfast, police added.

328.title: 2 minor girls killed as fire breaks out in slums of Indore
328.article_body: Two minor girls aged six and four were allegedly killed after a fire broke out at a slum in Indore on Monday. The fire which started in a slum that belonged to Sonu Medha reportedly spread to other parts. After initial inquiry police said, the fire was a result of deliberate arson following a dispute between Sonu and his family.

329.title: Not a huge fan of Du Plessis, I don't see anything special in his captaincy: Akhtar
329.article_body: Ex-Pakistan pacer Shoaib Akhtar has said he's not a huge fan of RCB captain Faf du Plessis and would like to see if the 37-year-old can revive the franchise's fortunes. "At times, Plessis doesn't look that sharp during his leadership. He has been given the responsibility of leading a huge franchise...I'm not sure how far Faf will go," stated Akhtar.

330.title: Fire breaks out in Navi Mumbai, no casualties reported
330.article_body: A fire broke out in the Maharashtra Industrial Development Corporation (MIDC) area in Mahape, Navi Mumbai on Tuesday. As per initial reports, a diesel pipeline leak is believed to be the reason behind the fire occurrence. However, no casualties have been reported so far. An official from the Vashi fire station said that the "fire has been brought under control".

331.title: Dad constantly reinvented himself, I've secretly imbibed his passion: Ranbir
331.article_body: Actor Ranbir Kapoor said that his late father and actor Rishi Kapoor constantly reinvented himself. "I have secretly imbibed from him his passion and his belief that it's all about the process and not the result," Ranbir said, adding that Rishi believed that every actor has to find his own way and that you have to learn from your mistakes.

332.title: HC stays trial court summons to Subramanian Swamy in defamation case
332.article_body: Delhi HC stayed the summons and other proceedings issued by Rouse Avenue Court against Rajya Sabha MP and BJP leader Subramanian Swamy in a defamation case. Delhi BJP spokesperson Tajinder Pal Singh Bagga alleged that Swamy had posted a defamatory tweet against him. Swamy had tweeted, "Journalists from Delhi told me...before joining BJP, Bagga was jailed several times...for petty offences."

333.title: I think Mohammed Siraj will be excellent against Jos Buttler: Hogg
333.article_body: Ex-Australia cricketer Brad Hogg has said RCB pacer Mohammed Siraj will be excellent against RR's right-handed batter Jos Buttler in their match in IPL on Tuesday night. "Siraj is getting the ball to come back into the right-handers and he likes to attack that middle and leg-stump line," stated Hogg. Buttler scored 100(68) in RR's last game against MI.

334.title: What are the causes?: Traffic police on video of accident in Hyd
334.article_body: Cyberabad Traffic Police on Monday shared a video of a non-fatal bike accident in Hyderabad's Raidurgam and questioned what are the accident's causes. The police also listed three mistakes of the car driver including not maintaining safe distance, not following lane discipline and wrong overtaking. The video purportedly shows the car hitting the bike while overtaking another car.

335.title: Kashmiri Pandit shopkeeper injured as terrorists fire upon him in J&K
335.article_body: A Kashmiri Pandit shopkeeper, Bal Krishnan, received critical gunshot injuries on hands and legs after he was fired upon by terrorists near his house in Shopian district of Jammu and Kashmir.  Krishnan, who was injured in the fourth terrorist attack in the valley in 24 hours, was taken to the Army hospital in Srinagar.

336.title: My son is mentally unstable: Father of IIT grad who attacked 2 policemen in UP
336.article_body: A day after an IIT graduate was arrested for attacking two policemen outside the Gorakhnath temple in Uttar Pradesh, the accused's father claimed that his son was not mentally stable. "Since childhood, he has suffered from depression...He believed that police were after him," his father said, adding that he had no intention to commit the crime.

337.title: Japan flies 20 Ukrainian refugees into Tokyo by special flight
337.article_body: The Japanese government flew a special flight to bring 20 Ukrainian refugees to Tokyo on Tuesday. The refugees, including 15 women, were reportedly aged between six to 66 years. "The government of Japan is committed to provide the maximum support to these 20 Ukrainians to help them live with a sense of peace in Japan," said Foreign Minister Yoshimasa Hayashi.

338.title: Lashkar-e-Taiba terrorist held in joint operation in J&K's Sopore
338.article_body: A Lashkar-e-Taiba (LeT) terrorist was arrested in Jammu and Kashmir's Sopore, police said on Monday. The terrorist was arrested in a joint operation by the Indian Army and J&K Police from Ladoora area of Rafiabad. "The apprehension of LeT terrorist averted a major incident in North Kashmir. He was assigned to plan attack on security forces personnel," the police added.

339.title: Nobody negotiated with Hitler: Polish PM to Macron over talks with Putin
339.article_body: Polish PM Mateusz Morawiecki criticised French President Emmanuel Macron for holding talks with Russian leader Vladimir Putin over Ukraine. "Mr. President Macron, how many times have you negotiated with Putin, what have you achieved? Have you stopped any of the actions that have taken place? One should not negotiate with criminals, one should fight them...Nobody negotiated with Hitler," he said.

340.title: CRED announces first few winners of CRED bounty
340.article_body: CRED announced that with CRED bounty, members can buzz friends and win big this IPL season. Deepak Gupta won Apple package, including iPhone, MacBook, AirPods, and more, CRED revealed, adding that Amit Ghosh won Greece cruise trip and Diwanshu Gaur, Azhar Saifi and Sachin Sharma won Tanishq jewellery worth ₹2 lakh, Amazon vouchers worth ₹2 lakh, and Sony package respectively.

341.title: Virat Kohli said younger members of team felt intimidated by Anil Kumble: Vinod Rai in book
341.article_body: Ex-CoA chairman Vinod Rai, in his book, said that Virat Kohli mentioned to him that young members of Team India felt intimidated by the way Anil Kumble worked with them when he was the head coach. "It was conveyed that Kumble was too much of a disciplinarian and hence the team members were not too happy with him," he wrote.

342.title: Jaaved Jaaferi to return as Hindi commentator for Takeshi's Castle 2: Report
342.article_body: Actor Jaaved Jaaferi will reportedly return as a Hindi commentator for Takeshi Kitano-hosted Japanese game show 'Takeshi's Castle 2'. Sharing a post about the show that mentioned 'the best part was the Hindi commentary by Jaaved Jaaferi', he tweeted, "Hmm! What do you think?#TakeshisCastle #OnceMore". Taking to the comments section, one user commented, "Will only watch if you're [commentating]!"

343.title: Ensure no further illegal construction around Jama Masjid: HC to NDMC
343.article_body: Delhi High Court on Monday directed the North Delhi Municipal Corporation (NDMC) and Archaeological Survey of India (ASI) to ensure that no further illegal construction takes place around Jama Masjid. A PIL was filed which argued that no construction or reconstruction is to be permitted around the ancient monuments in the area but authorities failed to act against the violations.

344.title: Price of lemons increases to ₹10 each in April in Pune: Report
344.article_body: The price of lemons has increased to ₹10 each from the previous ₹2 each in January and ₹5 each in March in the retail market, the Hindustan Times reported. The report said that the price rise is due to heat waves. "Rate of lemon in the wholesale market is between ₹2,000 and ₹2,500 for...300-500 lemons," a traders' association's president said.

345.title: Missing 15-year-old girl found killed in hit-and-run case in Delhi
345.article_body: A day after a girl (15) went missing, she was found killed in a hit-and-run accident in Delhi's Mayapuri, police said. The girl was heading to her aunt's house when a speeding car hit her, after which onlookers rushed her to the hospital where she was declared dead, police said. However, the deceased's family has alleged laxity by the police.

346.title: UK MP Imran Khan sexually assaulted man in his sleep in Pakistan, court told
346.article_body: UK MP Imran Ahmad Khan sexually assaulted a man in his sleep after smoking marijuana and drinking whisky, a court has heard. The man alleged that Khan sexually assaulted him at a guest house in Pakistan in 2010. The Conservative MP is on trial at Southwark Crown Court for sexually assaulting a 15-year-old boy at a house in January 2008.

347.title: Musk is sending strong signal to Twitter CEO Agrawal: Cathie Wood
347.article_body: ARK Invest's Cathie Wood said that Tesla CEO Elon Musk is "sending a strong signal" to the new Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal, after Musk's 9.2% Twitter stake was revealed. She added Musk is making a statement about censorship and that Musk doesn't believe in it. Wood also discussed that the news could also be "setting up for another leadership change".

348.title: Elderly Sikh man assaulted in New York; Indian consulate condemns
348.article_body: An elderly Sikh man, Nirmal Singh, was reportedly assaulted in US' New York. Images of the victim with a bloodied turban, face and clothes surfaced on social media. Calling it "deeply disturbing", the Consulate General of India in New York condemned the incident and said they were in touch with the police investigating the incident.

349.title: Decline in dropout rates among schoolgirls in 3 yrs: Govt
349.article_body: Dropout rates among schoolgirls declined to 1.2% at the primary level in 2019-20, Union Minister Annapurna Devi told Parliament. At the secondary level, the dropout rates fell from 18.4% in 2017-18 to 17% in 2018-19 and then to 15.1% in 2019-20.
