Devi said Bihar accounted for the highest dropout rate in three years at the upper-primary level.

350.title: IndiGo flight makes emergency landing at Nagpur airport, smoke seen coming out of aircraft
350.article_body: A Lucknow-bound flight had to make an emergency landing at the origin after take-off from Nagpur due to a suspected technical snag, the airline said on Monday. The Directorate General of Civil Aviation ordered an inquiry into the incident after smoke was seen coming out of the aircraft, said a senior DGCA official.

351.title: I hope KGF 2 also works: Shahid on Jersey's clash with KGF 2
351.article_body: Shahid Kapoor's upcoming sports-drama 'Jersey' is set to clash with Yash-starrer 'KGF: Chapter 2' on April 14. The actor, during a promotional event for 'Jersey', opened up about his film being the underdog in comparison with 'KGF: Chapter 2'. "I feel...the scale doesn't matter. If a movie is good I think it'll work...I hope KGF 2 also works," Shahid said.

352.title: MP govt to introduce digital locker system in all colleges, universities
352.article_body: In a move to provide marksheets, certificates, migration, and other documents to students digitally, the Madhya Pradesh government is set to introduce a digital locker system in all of the state's colleges and universities. The documents will be made available to students through this system phase-wise, an official informed. In the first phase, marksheets will be made available, he added.

353.title: Licence to meat shops only if they agree to not operate during Navratri: South Delhi Mayor
353.article_body: South Delhi Municipal Corporation Mayor Mukkesh Suryaan has said that from now onwards licences for running meat shops will be issued to traders only if they agree not to operate during the Navratri. Suryaan has also written to CM Arvind Kejriwal to withdraw discounts on alcohol during Navratri and, if possible, stop the sale of liquor for those nine days.

354.title: 32-yr-old drowns in a lake at Mumbai's Sanjay Gandhi National Park
354.article_body: A 32-year-old man died after drowning in a lake at Sanjay Gandhi National Park (SGNP) in Mumbai's Borivali on Monday, police said. "The deceased, Uday Pinker, had gone for a picnic with his four companions and allegedly jumped into the river after having lunch and liquor," they added. His body was taken out after three hours of search, police said.

355.title: Rajamouli dances to 'Naatu Naatu' at 'RRR' success party, video surfaces
355.article_body: A video of director SS Rajamouli dancing to the song 'Naatu Naatu' at the success party of 'RRR' has surfaced online. The party was hosted by producers Dil Raju and Shirish on Monday, and it was also attended by actors Ram Charan and Jr NTR. The film also featured Alia Bhatt, Ajay Devgn and Shriya Saran in the key roles.

356.title: I'd tell Pooran to just play his game, if you feel like smacking it, do it: Shastri
356.article_body: Ex-India head coach Ravi Shastri has said SRH wicketkeeper-batter Nicholas Pooran should "just play his game" and not worry about what the team expects. "Because if he starts thinking too much...that's when such players at times lose their rhythm," explained Shastri. Pooran has scored 0 and 34 in SRH's two games so far in the ongoing IPL season.

357.title: 'Pawry' gone 'Awry': UP police on people partying on car roof video
357.article_body: Uttar Pradesh Police has shared a video on Instagram of people partying on a car's roof with the heading- "A car-roof-top 'Pawry', gone 'Awry'". The police also captioned the post, saying that a "complimentary treat" is on them if they find people partying on the "wrong rooftop". "Please send...invitation to 112 and Uttar Pradesh Police too," the police added.

358.title: SRK, Akshay unsuccessful; wonderful to be generation's successful host: Kangana
358.article_body: Actress Kangana Ranaut took to her Instagram Stories to say that actors Shah Rukh Khan, Ranveer Singh, Akshay Kumar and actress Priyanka Chopra are "unsuccessful hosts". "Only Shri Amitabh Bachchan ji, Salman Khan ji...and Kangana Ranaut have achieved...this glory to be super star host," she said, adding that she feels wonderful to be the only successful host of her generation.

359.title: 97 swords, 2 kukris seized from courier parcels in Pune
359.article_body: Pimpri Chinchwad Police seized 92 swords, 2 kukris and 9 scabbards worth ₹3.7 lakh from a consignment en route to Aurangabad at a courier firm's office in Pune's Dighi. They also seized five more swords worth ₹15,000 from another consignment being sent to Ahmednagar. The vigilance officer, who spotted the weapons while scanning parcels, had immediately informed the police.

360.title: 2 women held in Chandigarh in connection with dowry death case
360.article_body: Chandigarh Police arrested two women in connection with around a two-year-old dowry death case in which a newly married woman died by suicide at her house in Ramdarbar. The victim’s husband was arrested earlier. The two women include the victim’s mother-in-law and sister-in-law. "An FIR was lodged on the statement of the victim’s father in 2019," a police officer said.

361.title: AIADMK worker, 4 others surrender over DMK worker's murder in TN
361.article_body: Five people, including an AIADMK worker, on Monday surrendered before a court in Tamil Nadu's Chengalpet after a DMK worker was killed at a bus stand in broad daylight in Chennai a day before. The accused AIADMK worker and the deceased were reportedly fighting over a spot at the bus stop where the latter had put up a water stall.

362.title: France to expel "many" Russian diplomats; Moscow vows response
362.article_body: France on Monday said that the country has decided to expel "many" Russian diplomats, "whose activities are contrary to our security interests". "This action is part of a European movement," the French Foreign Ministry said amid the war between Russia and Ukraine. Moscow will respond to France's move, Interfax news agency reported, citing the Russian Foreign Ministry.

363.title: Two execs leave Trump's Truth Social after troubled app launch: Report
363.article_body: Two senior executives of former US President Donald Trump's social media venture Truth Social have resigned from their posts, Reuters reported. Josh Adams and Billy Boozer's exit follows the venture's troubled launch of an iPhone app in February. Both the executives had joined the venture last year.  The exit of two executives could imperil the company's progress, sources said.

364.title: 4-lane steel bridge inaugurated at Silent Valley in Hyderabad
364.article_body: A four-lane steel bridge at Silent Valley in Hyderabad was inaugurated by Urban Development Minister KT Rama Rao on Monday. Built at a cost of ₹30.30 crore, the bridge is expected to reduce the distance between Jubilee Hills and Shaikpet from around 5 km to 3.5 km. The minister also inaugurated other infrastructure projects in the city on Monday.

365.title: 250 leaders and workers from AAP, Cong join BJP in Gujarat's Vadodara
365.article_body: Around 250 leaders and workers from AAP and Congress in Gujarat's Vadodara joined BJP on Monday. AAP leader Satish Makwana and Congress leader Jayshree Gohil were among those who joined BJP, an official release by the party stated. They joined BJP "considering the public service done by the party under PM Modi's leadership", BJP's state General Secretary Pradipsinh Vaghela said.

366.title: 1 dead, 39 injured as HRTC bus crashes into wall in Himachal; CM visits hospital
366.article_body: The driver of a Himachal Road Transport Corporation (HRTC) bus was killed and 39 passengers were injured when the vehicle, on its way from Manali to Shimla, rammed into a retaining wall in Mandi district. Initial reports claim the driver lost control while negotiating a sharp curve. Chief Minister Jairam Thakur visited the injured persons at the zonal hospital.

367.title: Qawwali singer who made provocative remarks in MP arrested from Kanpur
367.article_body: The Madhya Pradesh police arrested qawwali singer Sharif Parvaz, who was booked for making provocative comments against the country, PM Narendra Modi, Amit Shah and Yogi Adityanath from Kanpur. The qawwali singer was brought to Rewa after the arrest, the police said. He made the alleged controversial remarks while performing at a musical event in Rewa on March 28.

368.title: I am not 'anti-Indian': Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan
368.article_body: Pakistan Prime Minister Imran Khan has said, "I am not against any country. I am not anti-Indian or anti-American...I want friendship with them and there should be respect." Khan added he was against countries that disrespect other sovereign countries. Earlier, Khan, who was de-notified as PM of Pakistan, proposed the name of former Chief Justice Gulzar Ahmed as caretaker PM.

369.title: Constable harasses woman professor for wearing bindi in B'desh; held
369.article_body: A police constable in Bangladesh has been arrested for harassing and threatening to kill a woman professor of a private college for wearing a bindi, police said. Reportedly, the policeman had hurled abuses at Professor Lata Samaddar after seeing a bindi on her forehead and when the teacher protested, the policeman tried to run her over with his motorbike.

370.title: Mark Waugh made Test debut by replacing dropped twin Steve Waugh
370.article_body: Ex-Australian cricketer Mark Waugh made his Test debut in Ashes in 1991, replacing his elder twin brother Steve Waugh who was dropped over poor form. Mark later revealed when Steve had announced the news to the family, he found it "a bit awkward". Steve and Mark became the first twins to appear together in a Test on April 5, 1991.

371.title: Elon Musk starts poll on edit button, Twitter CEO Parag says 'Please vote carefully'
371.article_body: Tesla CEO Elon Musk has started a Twitter poll asking users if they want the microblogging platform to have an edit button. Responding to the poll, Twitter CEO Parag Agrawal said, "The consequences of this poll will be important. Please vote carefully." Earlier, Musk asked users if they believed Twitter rigorously adhered to the principle of free speech.

372.title: It is now or never if we want to limit global warming to 1.5°C: UN
372.article_body: Jim Skea, Co-Chair of IPCC Working Group III, which released UN's latest report on climate change, said, "It's now or never...if we want to limit global warming to 1.5°C." He added, "Without immediate and deep emissions reductions across all sectors...it'll be impossible." "We are on...pathway to global warming of more than double the 1.5°C limit," UN chief António Guterres said.

373.title: Biden’s granddaughter Naomi to hold wedding reception at White House
373.article_body: US President Joe Biden and First Lady Jill Biden will host their granddaughter Naomi's wedding reception at the White House. Naomi, 28, will marry 24-year-old Peter Neal, who is studying law at the University of Pennsylvania. "Peter and I are endlessly grateful to my Nana and Pop for the opportunity to celebrate our wedding at the White House," tweeted Naomi.

374.title: They are within you: Anushka as Mallika remembers her late parents' love story
374.article_body: Comedian Mallika Dua narrated her late parents, Vinod Dua and Dr. Padmavati Dua's love story. In the video, she said, "[My parents] got married and lived together happily ever after with a brief six-month gap between their respective journeys to heaven." Sharing Mallika's video on her Instagram Story, Anushka Sharma wrote, "They are within you. This is so beautiful Mallika."

375.title: Govt having discussion, should announce booster dose policy soon: Adar Poonawalla
375.article_body: Serum Institute of India CEO Adar Poonawalla has said, "We have appealed to the government (for a policy on booster dose of COVID-19 vaccines) as everyone who needs to travel needs to take the booster dose." He added, "They're having an internal discussion and should announce very soon in next few days on the booster policy."

376.title: Comical: HC after jail denies book to Elgar Parishad accused Navlakha
376.article_body: After the Taloja jail authorities denied giving Elgar Parishad accused Gautam Navlakha a PG Wodehouse book sent by his family, the Bombay High Court termed it "comical". "Is this true? Wodehouse is considered a security threat? This is really comical," HC said. Adding that this shows the attitude of jail authorities, HC stated, "At least basic needs should be met."

377.title: Our responsibility is to keep the country united: Maha minister
377.article_body: Maharashtra Energy Minister Nitin Raut on Monday, while reacting to MNS chief Raj Thackeray's comment to remove the loudspeakers from mosques, said, "It is our responsibility to keep the country united." "India is a country of different languages, religions and cultures...It is really sad that people are giving such statements about religion, it shows their mentality," the minister added.

378.title: Did we have loudspeakers during inception of religion? : BJP's Roopa Ganguly
378.article_body: After MNS chief Raj Thackeray opposed to the use of loudspeakers at mosques, BJP's Roopa Ganguly said a religion's campaign shouldn't make others "insane". "I don't understand, did we have the concept of a loudspeaker during the inception of religion? What's the point of it?" Ganguly added. "This process of playing loudspeakers 5-10 times a day shouldn't continue," Ganguly stated.

379.title: 2 held for trying to steal bullet train material in Navsari
379.article_body: Two people have been arrested for allegedly trying to steal bullet train construction material worth ₹14.85 lakh in Navsari on Monday. According to police, the accused, who were travelling in a car and tempo, loaded construction material onto them and tried to escape. When the security guard stopped the tempo, they abandoned their vehicles and fled the spot, police added.

380.title: I'm not pregnant, leave me alone: Hailey on pregnancy rumours after Grammys
380.article_body: American model Hailey Bieber has shut down pregnancy rumours after making an appearance at the Grammys 2022. Reacting to one of the reports claiming that she was expecting her first child with singer Justin Bieber, Hailey wrote, "I'm not pregnant, leave me alone". The model was hospitalised last month after suffering 'stroke-like symptoms'.

381.title: Plan was to hit yorker length: Avesh on missing hat-trick vs SRH
381.article_body: LSG pacer Avesh Khan has revealed that his plan was to bowl a yorker to dismiss Romario Shepherd, who survived his hat-trick ball in the 18th over in their match against SRH. On his performance, Avesh added, "It's been a great environment...[management] has been encouraging me to keep bowling as per my rhythm." Avesh picked four wickets in the game.

382.title: US approves potential sale of F-16 jets to Bulgaria amid Ukraine war
382.article_body: Amid the Ukraine war, US State Department has approved the potential sale of eight F-16 aircraft and related equipment to Bulgaria for $1.67 billion. "The proposed sale will improve Bulgaria's capability to meet current and future threats by enabling the Bulgarian Air Force to deploy modern fighter aircraft routinely in the Black Sea region," US Defense Security Cooperation Agency said.

383.title: Ukraine Prez to address UNSC over mass killings in Bucha
383.article_body: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelenskyy will address the UN Security Council on Tuesday over the mass killings reported in Bucha town. "These are war crimes and it will be recognised by the world as genocide," Zelenskyy had said after visiting the town. Pictures of bodies scattered on streets surfaced triggering strong reactions from world leaders, including US President Joe Biden.

384.title: Meta briefly blocked hashtags related to Bucha killings in Ukraine
384.article_body: Facebook-parent Meta briefly blocked hashtags related to civilian deaths in Ukraine's Bucha. "This happened automatically because of the graphic content people posted using these hashtags," Meta spokesman Andy Stone said. He added that the firm unblocked the hashtags after it was made aware of the issue. UN Secretary-General Antonio Guterres has called for an independent probe into the killings.

385.title: Punjab shopkeeper ties up, beats 6-yr-old boy on suspicion of theft
385.article_body: A case was filed on Monday after a shopkeeper in Punjab's Ludhiana allegedly tied up and beat a six-year-old boy with an iron rod on the suspicion that he stole a dress. The boy's mother claimed that her son told her he'd taken the dress to the shopkeeper after seeing it on the floor. The incident took place last month.

386.title: Gujarat dentist gets life term for killing her brother, his daughter
386.article_body: A sessions court in Gujarat’s Patan sentenced a dentist to life imprisonment until death for murdering her brother and his 14-month-old daughter with “datura” (thornapples) and potassium cyanide in 2019. The verdict pronounced noted that the accused committed the murder with “preplanning” where she slow poisoned her brother with datura in glucose water for six to eight months.

387.title: India reports 795 new COVID-19 cases, 58 deaths in last 24 hours
387.article_body: India has reported 795 new COVID-19 cases and 58 deaths in the last 24 hours, according to the Ministry of Health and Family Welfare. Out of the 58 deaths reported today, 56 were reconciled deaths in Kerala, while one death each was recorded in Delhi and Karnataka. This comes a day after the country saw 913 cases and 13 deaths.

388.title: Nursing body issues notice on book allegedly listing 'dowry merits'
388.article_body: Indian Nursing Council (INC) on Monday issued a statement over the alleged listing of "Merits of Dowry" in the Sociology for Nurses textbook, saying that it "strongly condemns any derogatory content" which is against the law. It also clarified that it only prescribes syllabus on its website. "Ugly looking girls can be married off with...attractive dowry," the book read.

389.title: No fine to be imposed for not wearing face masks in Chandigarh
389.article_body: Amid the declining number of COVID-19 cases, the Chandigarh Administration on Monday issued an order stating that no fine will be imposed for not wearing face masks in public places and workplaces. "However, the general public is advised to adhere to COVID-19 appropriate behaviour including wearing of face masks, hand hygiene and maintaining social distancing," the order reads.

390.title: It's not in India’s interest to increase Russian energy imports: US
390.article_body: The United States believes that it's not in India's interest to increase Russian energy imports and other commodities, said White House Press Secretary Jen Psaki on Monday. She, however, noted that India's imports of Russian energy represent only 1-2% of its total energy imports. She added that the US would be happy to be a partner in reducing India's reliance.

391.title: Samantha to be replaced from film with estranged husband Naga Chaitanya: Report
391.article_body: Samantha Prabhu will reportedly be replaced from a film that also starred her estranged husband Naga Chaitanya. Reports added, the former couple isn't interested in sharing screen together.  Previously, they were supposed to collaborate with director Nandini Reddy for a project, however, Nandini reportedly decided to stick with Naga and is now searching for an actress who can replace Samantha.

392.title: Amid loudspeaker row, Maha Home Minister Walse halts speech during Azaan
392.article_body: Maharashtra Home Minister Dilip Walse Patil stopped his speech during Azaan. The incident took place in Maharashtra's Shirur. While halting his speech, Walse reportedly gestured his followers to wait till Azaan was over. Meanwhile, MNS chief Raj Thackeray had earlier threatened to play 'Hanuman Chalisa' in front of mosques if loudspeakers in mosques were not silenced.

393.title: ₹2,000-5,000 fine for 1st drinking offence in Bihar, 1-yr jail if caught for 2nd time
393.article_body: The Bihar government has announced that a fine between ₹2,000 and ₹5,000 will be imposed on those who are caught drinking alcohol for the first time in the state. If first-time offenders fail to pay the fine, they can be imprisoned for a month. Those caught drinking for second time can be imprisoned for one year, if charges are proved.

394.title: Varun Dhawan congratulates WWE star Triple H on retiring, shares throwback pic with him
394.article_body: Actor Varun Dhawan took to Instagram to congratulate WWE star Triple H on retiring from in-ring action. Varun shared an old video of their interaction and a throwback picture. He wrote, "One of my all-time favourite WWE superstars hung up his boots at WrestleMania...I was fortunate enough to meet him...talk to him about my love of pro-wrestling and The Rock."

395.title: I know where India's economy is: Ramiz clarifies 'We'll see who goes to play IPL' remark
395.article_body: Pakistan Cricket Board (PCB) Chairman Ramiz Raja has clarified his remark wherein he had suggested that cricketers would prefer PSL over IPL once he takes PSL to the auction model and puts its purse in the IPL bracket. "I was misquoted...I know where the economy of India is and where is Pakistan's...We have plans to improve the PSL," Ramiz said.

396.title: Pune school denies entry to students over fee issue, allows later
396.article_body: Several students were denied entry and their parents were allegedly manhandled by the bouncers of the Euro School in Undri, Pune. They were readmitted after the intervention of the education department and police. According to Audumbar Ukirde, deputy director of education (Pune), the issue escalated after 61 students were given transfer certificates (TCs) for not paying last year's fee.

397.title: Bengaluru reports 36 new COVID-19 cases, 1 death
397.article_body: Bengaluru on Monday reported 36 new cases of COVID-19 and one related death, according to official data by Bruhat Bengaluru Mahanagara Palike. With 34 recoveries, the active cases in the city now stand at 1,399. Further, 8,471 people were vaccinated in the city on Monday. According to data, the positivity rate now stands at 0.93%.

398.title: Chandigarh issue should be resolved by sitting together: Haryana CM
398.article_body: Haryana CM Manohar Lal Khattar on Monday said that the Chandigarh issue should be resolved by "sitting together". "It’s not something that can be passed unilaterally in the Assembly," Khattar added. "They (AAP) have not been in power for four days and are raising these controversial issues, there must be a hidden agenda behind this," Khattar stated.

399.title: Curfew extended in Rajasthan's Karauli till April 7 after communal clashes
399.article_body: Section 144 of CrPC imposed in Rajasthan's Karauli, where communal clashes broke out, has been extended till April 7 in view of the law and order situation. Officials said class 10 and 12 students can reach their exam centres after showing their admit cards. A two-hour relaxation will be given to allow people to make essential purchases, officials added.

400.title: Alia to shoot for her H'wood debut in May after wedding with Ranbir: Report
400.article_body: Alia Bhatt, who is set to make her Hollywood debut with director Tom Harper's 'Heart of Stone', will begin shooting for the project in May, after tying the knot with Ranbir Kapoor this month, according to a report. "Post her wedding in mid-April, she will be flying to the United States Of America for her film's shoot," the report said.
